reviewText:
Ok so- I own this game. I have owned it a while. I enjoy it. But there's a ton of people posting negative reviews for stupid reasons. Up to and including: - Shooting zombies is very ineffective unless it's the head (Yes someone actually posted this).  I think too many people compare it to Left 4 dead and other similar games and it's a different experience. People also are complaining about the devs responses, when they leave up posts calling thier game outright trash, ect. ect. . I enjoy coop games, I really enjoyed SWAT 4, I enjoy Left 4 Dead, Payday, and I enjoy this. That being said here's a realistic pro / con list for you:

Pro
-Co oP is fun-
You need to share ammo. You need to share weapons. Health kits are super rare and you have to arbitrate who they go to.  You have to work together.

-Immersion-
Rage zombies were never my thing. Nothing against them but to me the slow shambling ones are the way it's done. If your a fan of oldschool zombie movies- There ya go. It's got that feel to it. Voice acting-A lot of work went into this. It's not stellar by any means but there are two radials with different sayings for most of them. Top that off the characters will be louder or quiet based on certain factors (If the person is crouching or havent done any movements yet - the voice of character will be quieter than usual. If character took a shot or someone near by shot - they will speak loud. They will also speak loud when they were running for quite long time or there is action going on).  If someone goes down, they become a zombie and can call the horde and hunt down thier former friends. I always had a lot of fun with it and it helps with the immersion which is a big thing in games for me.

-Modes-
There are a fair number of modes for this game. I look at some of the games coming out nowadays like Evolve (Don't get me wrong I enjoy it, I play it, but it was too much for what it was) that are essentially one game mode stretched to thin. The same could be said about a lot of games, some would say it about this one, but at least they tried. I tested some of the other ones, none were as much fun as coop.

Con
-The graphics are dated-
This isn't a deal breaker for me but it is for a lot of people OMARGAWRD THUR GRUAFAX".

-The Co-op is unintuitive-
It's true
date: there's not going to be any Left 4 Dead highlighting of objectives. You have a cell phone that you check that tells you where to go / what to do. You have to actually figure it out for yourselfs

reviewText:
I've played this game on and off and I feel like its time for a review after spending some of my time on this game.

Summary:
This is just your typical cliche zombie survival game where your basic objective is to survive (Duh!). You select from a handful of characters to decide who you want to be and go straight to business; shooting zombies and people. There are different modes in the game in which you can play: Escape, hunt, and extract.

Escape:
This is the primary mode that this game was probably built for. It is purely PvE where players come together to find a way out of a selected environment. There are different difficulties to test your skills in both individual and team gameplay. What I found really unique and interesting in this mode was that everytime you played it, it was always some what different every run. Your pathing to the ending of each map was usually different and this somewhat made the game mode fresh everytime.

What I found to be a failure in this mode was that the ending of escape was always the same and my incentive to play again was minimal. There are no rewards for completing and it gets really repititive. Basically all you did was shoot zombies, find objectives, and get out. Another thing was how it could be absurdly difficult at times. Although this was also a reason as to why it was somewhat fun, a lot of the time you would find yourself back tracking to find missing objectives or paths to work your way to the end, all the while wasting ammo on zombies because you had no choice. Another thing was that players could turn into zombies if they were attacked or dead. I could see how dead players who turned to zombies could potentially create a left 4 dead PvP scene where teamwork is key, but the problem is that zombie players could single-handedly wipe out a whole team of players because thats just how strong and difficult a zombie player is to handle (I literally just walk in zig zags and no one could kill me and I would just kill them in like 5 hits). This adds to frustration of playing this mode as if looking for objectives while fighting AI zombies wasn't already a chore. My suggestion would to make this purely PvE and leave PvP for hunt and extract, which I will discuss about next.

Hunt:

If all you want to do is walk around and shoot people or be a zombies and kill people, this is the mode for you. It is purely PvP. Everyone starts out with a basic secondary weapon (handgun) and melee weapon and have to search for weapons that can be found in various areas across a map. While doing so, players will encounter eachother and kill eachother. But again, it can feel repetitive as the sole purpose of this mode is to just walk around killing eachother (Of if you like the classic camping you can do that too)  till the round ends with only 1 survivor or the round times out.

Because of how the mode is set up to end, players are basically encouraged to actually camp if they want to win. This can really ruin the fun as some people play it for the action and interactions between finding eachother. You could go AFK in a basement and win the round by doing literally nothing because while you decided to sit like a scared child, other people were actually playing the mode as how it was supposed to be played; by finding and killing eachother. You will find out yourself about how the community may react to you camping if you decide to play this game/mode.

Extract:

This mode is probably one of the least favorable modes in the game. What you do is work as a team to find AI survivors and rescue them to a safe point. Although this sounds potentially challenging or fun, it is again very boring and repititive (in my opinion,  of course). There is no real goal in this mode because once you rescue the AIs, you are back to square one; Finding and saving AI's again. You will eventually find yourself leaving the game rooms as you die from zombies and ultimately boredom.

Music/Sounds:

What really shines, in my opinion, is the music and sounds of the game. It is very high quality and really fits the overall theme of the game. It creates an eerie feeling to the game when playing and is what really drew me into the game's atmosphere. Voice acting is great as well, although most of these characters are abit too grumpy and mad (For good reason probably).

Graphics:
The graphics in this game are good if not great. Theres really nothing bad to say about the graphics... Besides sometimes I would enter servers where the game was all choppy at times and looked like I was playing an 8-bit game with low FPS. Other than that, graphics meet basic/standard expectations.

Weapons:
There are plenty of guns/weapons in this game. Honestly, depending on which weapon you have, alot of them are pretty similar in terms of effectiveness. Although you'll probably find  some guns to be a lot weaker and useless compared to others ( F****** colt), it isn't really an issue to the game.

Characters:
The handful of characters as I mentioned in the beginning of the review, all have the same value in the game. There is no OP or weak character, it is all preference of how you want to look. Sadly, I would have prefered to be able to customize my own character or let the characters available to have stats so that it would fit people's preferred playstyles. In this game's case, your best bet is to be the black guy (No racism intended) because he best blends into the night and camouflages very well in PvP.

Conclusion:   6.5/10 Rating

Ultimately, what really brought Contagion down is the repititiveness of the game. The replay value of this game is really low, as I have dropped and picked up this game on and off over the year, only playing it every few times a month when I was really bored. Content is slow to release and while there is a steam workshop for this game, there isn't much it has to offer because this game lacks strong popularity within the zombie fan community. You will find yourself picking up this game for about the first hour or so, and then immediatly dropping it if you have no friends to play with.

Thanks if you actually read this long review. Although it seems like im not recommending this game at all, surely it is not the case. This game did have its great and fun values. But it only hit me ever so softly, and I feel that it can be fixed.

Is it worth trying this game? Yes definitely, but get ready to drop it.
Is it worth the money? No, I would recommend buying it on sale.


TL;DR:  This game can be fun, but gets boring and repititive too quickly to really be worth its costs. I would still recommend trying it though if you can get it at a low price.

reviewText:
I have been a long term Contagion gamer so feel qualified to write a fairly unbiased review.

TL;DR Each of the reviews you see below praising the game but critcising the developers are accurate.  It is that simple.  Also, team killing is rife which completely destroys the gameplay and forces individuals to use the easier non-TK servers which quickly become boring.  The developers have also taken no action against the numerous trolls who use certain choke points in the levels to ensure that gamplay is stopped.   The game community is almost completely extinct largely due to the developers shocking attitude to their customers.

LR;  When I first started playing Contagion last year the Developers were embroiled in a lengthy update process.  The community was disnechfranchised including certain individuals who had supported via Kickstarter and were still waiting on rewards.  I decided to let that slide and decide for myself.

The gameplay is good with tense moments and very acceptable graphics using the CS engine.  To the developers credit some of the levels are huge, the biggest in the Steam library by some estimates.  Nice use of fire and shadow makes for interesting human versus zombie battles.

Once killed a human player becomes a zombie and must attack and kill/turn the remaining human survivors.  However this creates a unique dynamic because once killed you drop your weapons and ammo.  Players naturally want certain weapons or more ammunition and team kill individuals to get it which forces the majority of the community to use non-TK servers which are far easier to beat because the zombies and objectives are easier to achieve with more abundant ammo.

Zombies are blessed with the ability to track humans, summon NPC zombies and direct zombie hordes.   Quite often the zombie players win if they are experienced and know how to ambush.  However if the humans are experienced then becoming a zombie is chore because the humans bunch at choke points...due to the fact that once a zombie is killed a certain number of times they become a spectator to the game.  So experienced players simply find an alley/corridor and wait.  They kill zombie attackers over and over forced into the alley until they become spectators then continue with the objectives.   The only way to win is hope that a new player is within the crowd and will make a mistake leading a gap in the team.

Because of the dev attitude, the team killing and the trolling, the game's user base has dwindled and you will often see the same 10-20 people hopping between servers some of which alleviate their boredom through trolling the levels to make them uncompletable.  Examples include stopping people from using critical elevators or preventing NPC characters from being rescued by leading them away from the exit zones.

Unofrtunately the user base has also dwindled in part due to the shocking attitude of the developer Tatsur0.  I had read numerous reviews on Steam and on the gaming press about his attitude to paying customers but disregarded them.  However as the updates dragged out from weeks to months to over 9 months it was hard to accept his constant refutations to customers.   In the end a bug-riddled update was issued with new maps but missing promised weapons, skins and game modes which are apparently coming soon".  The developer response on the forums is always "I promise nothing" and "Go play other games."

People who criticised the developers were continually banned whilst trolls and team killers cannot be dealt with unless you supply video-evidence to the developers.

During my supportive period I even wrote a lengthy strategy for the developers (I have launched several apps and work in App Development) about how to really engage the audience during updates and prevent users leaving.  It was so well received some of the gamers even said I should be hired.   The post was ignored with a response "We don't have time to do any of that stuff."   I shrugged that off and continued to pour time into the forums and the game.

My decision to exit the game came after Tatsur0 refused to acknowledge the fact that Windows 10 renders the game unplayable (no sound
date:
stuttering).   After I flagged this and asked how many users were planning to take advantage of the free Windows upgrade my topic was flagged as spam (under the heading "Not relevant to Contagion") and the response was

"Users know we don't support Windows 10 so Valve handle refunds."

I cannot in good faith recommend that new users devote any kind of time to a game whose community has almost disappeared despite being a pretty good game.

I honestly hope the Developers learn how to deliver a better customer service experience to the community that keep them in business."

reviewText:
Contagion had potential.  Unfortunately some of the developer's seem to have thick skulls when players are making complaints or suggesting feedback.

Not only that, but I mean how long have we been waiting for this free DLC that has missed its promised release date, what, 3 times now?  Pretty sure its been going on for over a year.  I'm under the impression that there's crap for organization and these developers have their priorities elsewhere.  Don't buy this game at full price, wait until its on a 75% off sale if you want to get your moneys worth.

edit: If you do purchase the game don't get your hopes up.  You'll rarely see updates or adequate dev/community communication, and you'll be playing with a dwindling/near non-existent community.

reviewText:
This is a draft review, I'll rewrite this word-hurricane later, treat it like a blueprint.

The game is late by about 8 years in terms of graphics, animations, gameplay and just about anything else you could name. It costs about $20, but for that you get about 3 coop maps and... 3-4 PvP maps. That's it! The game modes do not differ greately, except the coop ones of which there are two and they get boring rather quickly. Maps do change, but the routes are easily remembered, there are about three variations for each coop map, but if you ask me an occaisonally open door that was closed before does not make much of a difference, the tasks are varied but like I said only change twice or thrice per map.

But this isn't even the biggest problem. The worst flaw of the game is what is meant to be its selling point. The devs have made the multiplayer system so difficult and broken it is impossible to join your friends server (trust me I've spent 4 days trying every single solution on forums). The only way to do so is to download third-party programs like Hamachi and I have no intention to do that since I've had less problems joining in a 1999 System Shock 2. The devs are aware of this problem, but they don't want to fix it. Trust me, as I have spoken to them and they say they are denying any bit of constructive criticism. I think they are hinting at that rent a server" feature instead. Pay-to-play? No thanks. And if you don't want a server and just want to play with your friends

reviewText:
At the time of writing this (11/2/2013 ), Contagion is still currently in beta form.

With that being said....Contagion already outperforms most triple A title retail releases. With it's addictive game modes, dead on gameplay and rock solid servers, Contagion is already putting some life back into the into the online co-op survival horror genre laid out by classics such as Left4Dead and the Killing Floor.

Running on an optimized Source engine Contagion's graphics are sharp, smooth and alive with death around every corner. From the lighting effects in the dark corridors to the reflection effects seen in mirrors, lakes and puddles the developers have created a world filled with atmosphere. Yet, the sound in Contagion is what will immediately draw you into it's world. Each echo, gunshot in the distance and glass under foot will immerse you into this adrenaline filled horror show. Each and every thing about Contagion screams instant classic!

I have never written a review while a game was still in Alpha or Beta form but, the developers created an experience that I can't get enough of and I wanted to put any questions to rest as to whether or not you should purchase this now while in Beta or after the final release.

Although I wouldn't consider this my final review, I will absolutely recommend Contagion to everyone here on the Steam platform.

If you've never been part of a Beta release and the excitement that goes along with being a part of a successful title in the making or if you always wanted to say you were there from the beginning before everyone else jumped on the bandwagon before it became a household name.....This is your opportunity!!!

I 100% recommend purchasing Contagion in Beta form or otherwise. I go as far to say you'd be crazy not to. Trust me as the title states this game is contagious!!!

Contagion Beta (V2990) review 9.2/10!!!
Buy this game!!!

reviewText:
Please note that this Early Access review is not a substitute for a comprehensive bug report.

Contagion is the zombie game purists have been waiting for since they first cracked open The Zombie Survival Guide".

For me
date: that's about ten years. For ten years I've waded through a horde of zombie games. Nothing emulated the raw feeling of isolation and cold that a gunshot in the distance or a scream or absolute silence can bring. We're all familiar with Brooks' original canon for zombies. Only headshots kill them. Eat flesh until they can't. Only sensory organs that have not been decayed or destroyed work. A moan causes others to moan
recommended: and they are attracted to the sound like a foghorn in the night. I never felt like I would truly find the zombie game that emulated this canon so perfectly. First there was Dead Rising - a close contender - followed by Dead Space [which opened a whole new can of worms] and Dead Island
hoursPlayed: which underperformed in basically every aspect. Left 4 Dead left a hollow feeling

reviewText:
I really enjoy playing this game's multiplayer.

Unfortunately, I can't. At peak hours there's next-to-no players, unless you want a 250+ ping connection to Russia or you want to join the only other one player trying to play Extraction, who will without fail always be a child with a microphone and no parental supervision.

The gunplay leaves a lot to be desired; the animations are stiff and the movement is poor. The maps are very easily abused, with a number of easy-to-reach for human spots in the free-for-all mode (hunted) that make playing as a zombie post-mortem ever more unbearable. I really, really want to enjoy this game. And I did when it actually had players, forever ago. If you have friends and you can buy the 4-pack on sale, it's a blast, but if you're a solo player (like me) that wants to join random online public games, you're out of luck.

reviewText:
(This review was written during early access beta 11/25/13)
For an early access game, over all very good.
Pros: mazing unique gameplay and revolutionary game modes and maps. Amazing multiplayer with 8+ slots in servers, allows maximun co-op potential. Over all impressive game, I for one am very exited to see whats next in future updates such as: new guns, maps, and game modes. Which leads me to the cons section

Cons: First of all this game is not finished, so if you can't stand bugs every now and then, then wait for the full release. But this game does have its fair share of bugs such as slight graphics and model glitches. Nothing unbearable. This game currently only has 4 maps, a hand full of guns/weapons etc. so nothing major when it comes to variety at the moment. but like i have said before, this game is definitelly not finished and is updated regularly so there will be lots more maps and weapons.

My rating would be a 8.5. I would bump that up to a 9.2 when the bugs get patched and new maps and guns get added.

Over all review is that I would most definitelly buy this game if your looking for a fun co-op fps/zombie survival game to play with friends and can wait for updates and put up with bugs. Keep up the good work!

reviewText:
Note: I had given this game a negative review after playing it for about 5 or 6 hours initially.

I feel this game is hit or miss as a whole; it is not for everyone. It's really important to know what kind of zombie game this is before going in a game and expecting fast paced zombie killing. It is entirely a mix of fast paced zombie shooters mixed with the occasional waiting around to hold out.

If you are the type of player who enjoy constant shoot'em ups not having to worry about an ammo count and slashing your way through thousands of zombies... then go play Left 4 Dead. This game is not for you.
However, if you enjoy games that require teamwork, conserving ammo, scavenging for supplies and using the limited resources around you then you should give this game a shot.

I have found that the community in this game is alarmingly small, but the players have been surprisingly nice. The few that do play regularly will go out of their way to help newer players to expand and enlarge the community with more people.

Every gun and melee in the game has a certain feel to it, and I guarantee there will be at least one that can cater to your liking. The zombies lack a little diversity when it comes to the aesthetics, but have pretty unique ways of moving around and sneaking up on the survivors making gameplay pretty interesting in the long run. PvP mode is available which creates an even more intense and horror-filled experience added to the gameplay.

And hey, there's free DLC coming with this game soon... so that's always a plus.

Paying $20 for this game still does seem a little pricey to me, the amount of content offered seems to fall a little short of the price. Maybe buy the game when it goes on sale. Contagion really favors a more strategic crowd when it comes to fighting zombies, includes mature players and pretty decent graphics for a HL2 modification overall.

reviewText: I've put more than sixty hours into this game and Contagion's gameplay design is fundamentally broken. I want it to be good, but it's not. This breaks my heart because I know that a team spent many many manhours trying to make this into a cool game. I really wish it was a proper successor to ZPS.\n\nComing from around a thousand hours in ZPS, I was attracted to Contagion's Escape" mode and I played this mode the most. There are other modes
date: but they are generally bland copycat "afterthoughts" that are done better in other games. Escape is the only mode that enticed me to get Contagion.\n\nHowever
recommended: Escape has numerous fundamental game design flaws that permanently gimp its gameplay. To illustrate
hoursPlayed: it's best to walk through a typical Escape game:\n\n"Escape" generally begins as a co-op mode with up to around 8 teammates. Initially
voteText: you're playing against only NPC zombies. However
helpfulPercent: the NPC zombies are completely boring to fight against. You either have boring citizen zombies that die to a single headshot or you have uninspiring bullet-sponge riot-armor zombies. I couldn't find any engaging strategy to defeat these bullet-sponges except repeated shots to the noggin. Therefore
votesHelpful: the NPC zombies are more of a chore to fight through.\n\nEven though players soon find that the NPC zombies don't post much threat
votesTotal: the level design
votesFunny: itself
commentsCount:
will kill them (either literally or figuratively):


There are simple "no no" level design decisions like the the frequent use of ladders. Since Contagion is built on Source
column16: ladders are horrific and will literally get players killed without any zombie involvement (Even Valve wisely prefers to not use ladders in Source). When I completed Camp Whitner for the first time
column17: I was led through by an experienced player (see showstoppingly confusing level design below) and he literally stops at one point to say
column18: "Watch out
column19: this ladder will kill you." I knew how Source ladders worked and carefully navigated down the shaft. My other inexperienced teammate did not and was instakilled by fall damage. The experienced player obviously knew about the trouble from that stupidly unnecessary ladder. I'm not sure how the developers could have so much experience with Source dating back to ZPS in 2007 and still not know that ladders are terrible level design.\n\nThere are also situations where the macro-scale level design pathing is so bad on certain maps that new players will just quit out of frustration. Maps like Barlow Square on Escape prematurely appear like easy-to-navigate "sandbox" urban "city" maps (awesome! right?). So at first you might go
column20: "oh cool
column21: that gun shop is a couple blocks west of our position. Let's make our way in that direction!" However
column22: you have ZERO navigational liberty and you are FORCED onto a 100% LINEAR path due to miles of chainlink fence that procedurally block every path except ONE. This might only be "bad"
column23: but it moves to "terrible" when you find out that the dynamic path is often obscurred and basically hidden. If you are a new player that isn't aware that there's exactly one path to move through the map
column24: then you will quickly get confused
column25: then frustrated
column26: then you'll quit. This happens on a painfully regular basis. The zombies don't end their fun - it's the map's level design that does that.\n\nFurthermore
column27: there are micro-scale level design issues. The latest example is one that I just experienced this morning.\nI was trying to beat Montclair with some equally inexperienced players and we got to a military medical base in a park. After easily clearing it of boring NPC zombies
column28: we walked past a locked gate and we were told to go find the key in the park. We didn't know what this "key" looked like
column29: but we combed the park nevertheless. We came up with nothing
column30: yet we kept looking for what felt like hours. It got so desparate that the player-controlled zombie started trying to help us find it. Eventually my only living partner turned into a zombie as a result of a random bite and I just quit to end that pitiful match. This is one example of how needlessly frustrating this game is. Stuff like this is simply unfun.\nBut if you manage to get through all of those inherent level design flaws
column31: then you'll notice that player-controlled zombies are frighteningly unbalanced. It gets so bad
column32: that some experienced players intentionally die at the beginning of the match just so they can single-handedly destroy their former teammates before they can even get through the first couple objectives. How in the world can it be so unbalanced?\n\nIt's almost impossible to hit a player zombie as compared to an identical NPC zombie. I've heard players claim that player zombies have unique hitboxes. My hunch is that the game has poor networking and it's normally masked by allowing NPC zombie hits to be credited only clientside (versus player zombie hits that must be validated serverside). Either way
column33: this is a very very very noticeable phenomena and it makes player zombies very difficult to deal with.\n\nOh and player zombies can "dodge" as well. The experienced ones know that if their head stays unscathed
column34: then they can tear through a group of players
column37: jump and do all sorts of stupid moves to turn themselves into a walking killing machine. That's not fun. This is not a featured capability. There's no tooltips or tutorials that explain all of the intricacies of this maneuvering. That tells me that it isn't a designed feature. And since it ruins entire Escape servers
column38: I say it's an exploit that is unpatched two years after release.\nI really drive home hard enough that this is a frustrating game to play. If I hadn't dropped a thousand hours in ZPS
column39: I would've abandoned it long ago. This game does not play like ZPS. It's something much much worse and that breaks my heart."

Don't buy for more than a few dollars.

reviewText:
Contagion is an action FPS involving everyone's favourite fictional creature, the zombie. Your aim in every match is to survive as long as possible and in some matches survive long enough to get an evac and if you're unlucky enough to be killed by the zombie horde you become one of them with the goal of killing the survivors. With ammo and weapons being very hard to come by how you use your ammo is of upmost importance.

+Nice graphics
+You get to play as survivors and zombies
+There are quite a few characters, each with their own backstory
+Quite a few different weapons, ranged and melee
+You can board up windows and doors to slow down advancing zombies
+Good soundtrack
+Headshots are one hit kill apart from on riot zombies, headshots are very satisfying
+You can play singleplayer or mutliplayer
+Workshop support

-Gets repetitive quickly and with no progression system it has very little replay value
-Hardly any players online
-Zombies don't look great, they're basically just grey humans covered in blood
-Some of the maps are very confusing
-Some maps don't have melee weapons so you're screwed if you run out of ammo

Verdict:
6

It's a fun zombie game but with little replayability this game is only worth getting if you're playing with friends and you get it on sale.

El K.

reviewText:
Negative aspects: The player community simple isn't large enough. There are typically no more than 50 people in the WORLD playing. Additionally, player zombies are extremely unbalanced and ruin co-op modes. When human players die in any game mode (co-op or PvP), they become zombies and wreak havoc on the remaining survivors. The fact that they make little or no noise, can move sporadically (combined with bad hit boxes), can lead and command up to 15 AI zombies, and have many respawns with no wait timer make them almost always unstoppable in the end. They should really only be in the Hunted game mode.

I also dislike that you cannot view the server list while already in a server. Further, you cannot even vote to kick/ban players or even to change the map.

Positive aspects: The developers put very much detail in the maps. There are many pathways and hidden areas, requiring exploration (and teammwork if playing co-op). The game also succeeds in the horror aspect, especially in Hunted mode.

reviewText:
I would recomend this to anyone who likes LFD1/2 DayZ and No more room in hell.

Its an 8 player coop game with differnt game types: escape, hunted, extraction, panic, spread over a number of differnt maps and the devs appear to be adding more quite regularly.
This game is alot slower then something like LFD, head shots are key to killing the zombies and if you get a bite from a zombie you can turn into one which can make things alot harder for the survivors. (its also ALOT of fun)
It can get crazy with lots of zombies and scary when your the only survivor left trying to make it to the end.

The only negatives to this game are the lack of players: sometimes it can be hard to find a good server but that is also getting better. Also if your new to the game starting out can be really confusing, there isnt anything telling you where to go exactly, you do have a phone that will txt you when objectives are complete but that is about it.

If you like coop zombie games get this! its well worth it.

reviewText:
UPDATED at 05 MAR 2014 with an actual changes. Some work is being done as gibbing on zombies, breakable doors and even one more map is released. However melee combat for humans is FYBAR. It's just even more horrible that before. I don't get it why they refused to use HL2MP default model and put something self-made. As soon as zombie get's in a melee range it's impossible to hit it either with pistol/revolver or with a melee attack - it just jumps around you. Same applies to a situation when you are out of ammo - melee weapon will cause more troubles because you think it will work. It won't, sadly. It's broken for 5 months long since initial beta release and haven't changed a bit in a positive way.

-----

Quite a let down for a team who created Zombie Panic: Source. Graphically it looks fairly good for an ye olde Source engine and custom sound engine does it's work really good. There are only 4 maps for now: one is co-op objective and three for Hunted (deathmatch) game mode. Also there is a extraction game mode but it's getting old pretty fast. So does the whole game.

But the problem is not in that there are few maps, rather strange recoil and jittery 3-rd person animations. The major problem is that word 'boring' does not fully describe playing Contagion as a zombie. While some features (like glow and outlines are being added) are being worked on, lack of features like mini-map or zombie shortcuts/paths for faster map navigation making that experience painful. Try playing on objective map as a zombie and you'll want to leave server quite fast because hanging around mindlessly over a huge map is not fun by any means. If you somehow find a way to survivors you have nothing extra that makes player controlled zombie better than a AI zombie. But being a human is no better. Somehow, Monochrome made a co-op game without most co-op related features. Really, all you need your buddies for is to carry a key? In fact, a some kid could get one and do not know it, so co-op progress will halt as other players even do not know who got a valuable co-op items!

Lastly, developers do not fix critical bugs and adjust game play mechanics as fast as I'd like to see in a multiplayer only game. They do regular content updates (like Halloween and X-mas updates) thought.

As for now, it's hardly a game I'd recommend to anyone due to it's gameplay. It's really gets boring after 2-5 hours of play. Pretty picture, neat sounds and randomized fences/ locked doors alone just can't keep the gameplay up.
Zombie Panic: Source is still a much better game. And it's free.

P.S. I've backed Contagion on Kickstarter and played the game before most other players. I will update my review tone if anything will change in a positive way.

reviewText:
This review is for the Release Version!

tl;dr version:
Though there are some issues with zombie pathing and balancing, the value you're getting at $20 is excellent considering there is Workshop support coming soon and that the devs are commited to bringing releasing free DLCs with new guns, characters, maps and even game modes.
Should you get it? if you like a challenge and prefer realistic gameplay, definitely.

Pros:
- excellent gun mechanics with realistic ballistics, penetration, recoil and decent weapon sounds
- atmospheric
- varied game modes (pvp, coop and survival)
- solid replayability on the escape maps (you actually get completely different endings, paths, objectives and loot spawn locations, unlike L4D2 that just makes loot random and the odd door here and there)
- challenging (you can die quite easily if you're not paying attention)
- good bullet detection in pvp and not a lot of lag either
- several characters to choose from
- good graphics (still the Source Engine, but the lighting is very good indoor and the weapon models are very detailed)
- a good variety of weapon types (melee weapons, sidearms, SMGs, ARs, shotguns, a sniper rifle, a crossbow and explosives)
- weapon animations are very well made
- devs are easy to reach to and helpful
- official modding support (SDK)
- upcoming Steam Workshop integration
- upcoming free DLC
- frequent updates

Cons:
- melee play feels clunky (still a lot better than DayZ though, but less fluid than Dead Island)
- pathing issues with zombies (has improved a bit since the alpha, but there are still issues, especially with doors)
- escape objectives are not very clear and can lead to a lot of head scratching at times
- due to the dynamic nature of the escape maps, balancing is hit or miss at times (you can either get quicly swarmed, not find enough ammo or end up with a riot zombie that blocks you and that you can't kill quickly enough)
- no option to control the volume level of the characters
- graphics are inconsistent in outdoor areas (some areas are detailed others not so much)
- few zombie models and only three zombie types" (slow
date:
fast and armored)
- fairly limited number of maps
- zombie animations can get stuck when in "roam mode" where you see the zombie continue to try and walk when he has an obstacle in front of him (happens a lot less since the last updates)
- crossbow bolts sometimes can't be retrieved (not sure if feature or bug :) )
- zombie clipping can occur (especially near closed doors that have to be activated by a switch)
- learning curve can be steep as there is no dedicated tutorial (this has improved since they've added tooltips post-release)

Personal opinion:
Personally

reviewText:
This game has a lot of potential but the developers sadly could not take advantage of that potential and left the game with many annoying and game experience breaking bugs and glitches.

The game had a huge potential and hope when it came to modding community but sadly the developer broke workshop at some point and didnt fix it for a long time which resulted in the very few modders that it had, to leave and never come back, as well as potential new modders were driven away from it.

The game has a game experience devastating glitch (which is easy to fix but developer dont take time to do so) which causes the zombies AI to stop attacking you. To give you a better meaning of this glitch I will demonstrate to you a recent situation that happened to me. I was walking back to a sewer entrance after I acquired gas mask (so I could enter the sewer) and I was attacked by suprise by a horde of zombies. I was thrilled as the situation seemed very desperate and I had to put up a good fight to survive. Yeah.... until I runned into an dead end on a balcony which I found to be a good spot to make a last stand, and it turned out that zombies dont attack me there like there was an invisible wall. I could shoot them all while they stood like a herd of sheeps. And such 'areas' are present in game throughout the maps people report them but developer dont fix them.

What is more, the zombies lack variety, there is of course more then 10 skins (or even 15) but still you get situation where 3 exact looking zombies attack you and overall you have a feeling of fighting an army of zombie clones.... sorry but a zombie game which has slow pace, should at least 50. Plus animations are pretty bad.

I would recommend the game for it pros as it has quite few, but I cant seeing how developer has stopped support and the game is left to root I cant, the reasons stated above are just not acceptable to recommend the game

reviewText:
This game really feels unpolished to the point that the gameplay is a little baffling.  Note that I'm just playing the co-op mode, and the perspective is based on that:
-Objectives are written in a first-person perspective, relying on character knowledge the player doesn't have.
-Equipment is scarce to the point of being bizarre.  Sure, you don't expect there to be ammo lying all over the place, but things like melee weapons are just as scarce, despite every location being littered with items you could use as a melee weapon.
-Characters often comment on using itmes on doors that aren't supposed to open, leading you to frustratingly use keys on each and every door you come across to find the one that will finally open.
-There's next to no feedback on the weapons and the type of ammo they should be using.  Sure, you'd expect  a bunch of strangers to not necessarily know everything about weapons they find, but it really doesn't feel like the intention of the game, considering you get the names of all the guns.  You don't have any feedback on the ammo you pick up either - how much of the shotgun shells do you have when you don't have a shotgun?  Your guess is as good as mine.
-Melee doesn't have the kind of impact you would expect - especially with something like a Sledgehammer.  There's no real feeling of force when you attack someone with a large weapon - leaving the whole experience rather unsatisfying.

It's not unplayable or anything.  It's just really bizarre.  While I appreciate the slower, careful pace compared to a game like Left4Dead, the lack of polish really gets in the way of a really good time.

Shame too.  There's potential here.  This game really should still be in early access.

reviewText:
This is another game where I wish you had a third option besides just yes/no. But since I do not think it's a yes then I have to choose no.

This game has way too many flaws to recommend which is a shame because I think it expanded on Left 4 Dead by adding different types of game modes and being able to ADS.

The biggest problem with the game is that it crashes all the time. If you finish a game and decide to switch to another server crash". If you are waiting for the next round "crash". It crashes at least once every game session I have with it. I have friends who play and it happens to them also.

The other problem are bugs/glitches in the game. For example
date: in extraction mode survivors can get stuck and will not move
recommended:
even if you tag them to follow you. I've had this happen on numerous occasions. Other times they just get stuck on ladders and you have to go all the way back when you realize they're not following you to tag them to unfollow then tag to follow again but take a different route so they don't get stuck on ladders again. Another problem with extraction is the route to lead the survivors doesn't always show up on the phone. So you're left wondering which way to go. Then there are glitches where you get stuck yourself and basically have to kill yourself to get free.

Other issues are gameplay issues. There is no mini-map. I don't have a huge problem with the concept of not having it except you have no idea what to do and where to go on a bunch of maps. The hints on the phone aren't helpful. For example on Roanaoke PD there are a couple of escape routes in the game. I'm not going to give anything away except that once you find the armory it doesn't tell you what to do next so you're left roaming around until you get somewhere that triggers the next hint. Obviously after you've played it you now know but for new players they'll have no idea and this is a long play session map. It's just annoying. If there were at least arrows or something to point you in the right direction that would be helpful.

While I do enjoy playing this game with friends
hoursPlayed: I think until some of these major issues are fixed I can't recommend this game. Some of these have been complained about for a long time so odds are this game isn't going to be improved. If you get it on a cheap sale it might be worth it otherwise there are better zombie games out there."

reviewText:
bought a 4 pack of this at beta stage, and iv found the updates that were quite wide and far between only seemed to make the game more and more terrible as time progressed. almost as if negative effort was being applied.
the gameplay is shoddy and dull at best. the one thing i seemed to like, which was zombies bodies reacting to shots and added my dynamic and tense gameplay, was removed. multiplayer, at best, can be called broken, at worst, called a steaming pile of dissapointment sprinkled with the remains of your 20 dollars. starting up a private server and playing by yourself was infinitely more tense and fun then joining a server and crashing to desktop or being stuck in a T pose with no way to progress through the level.

iv followed this game since it premiered on mod indieDB back 3-5 years ago, and found the gameplay of the actual game a stark, depressing contrast to the exciting dev videos i saw in my freshman year. this game is not finished. it was a nice effort of theirs calling it done, but its only done in namesake. its still thoroughly beta and each dissapointing buggy playthrough will only strengthen that belief

i give this completed" game 1 out of 9 empty dr. pepper cans currently in my room at the point of me writing this"

The ammo was a little scarce, but as long as you played slightly conservatively it wasn't a problem. The last 2 times playing the ammo was basically nil. reviewText:
+ Impressive visuals; exterior environments look incredible; water/rain effects really stand out and react wonderfully with lighting
+ Cell phone is a great feature that was integrated very well with gameplay
+ Only a handful of game-modes, but many of them are novel and fun with tons of replay value
+ Controlling zombies after death was very well implemented; devs put more thought into this than most games of the genre, and there is an unexpected amount of functionality
+ Maps are surprisingly large and easy to lose yourself in
+ Barricading mechanics are simple and intuitive
+ Game engine is very, very well-optimized; the game runs smoothly
+ Maps change every game; Objectives differ, paths close and open, item/weapon pickups are randomized
+ Voice communications operate on differing channels; survivors use one channel, and player-controlled zombies use another (this adds so much to the game, as player controlled zombies can effectively coordinate against their former companions, basically turning death into the start of a new game with new objectives, on the same map, against other players - VERY fun)
+ None of those endlessly recycled special" zombies that are so prevalent in other games of the genre (with the exception of a "riot-gear" zombie
date: but they are just scarce enough to be a minor challenge without the pitfalls of being irritating)\n\n- Melee weapons were not as well done as I've seen in other products of this genre
recommended: and they are rarely used; the game places an overwhelming emphasis on firearms\n\nIf you enjoyed this review
hoursPlayed: please follow my curator page. Also

reviewText:
Looks great, plays great but falls short
I bought this game on sale at 80% off, but I ended up still being dissapointed.

+Great graphics
+Level design is good
+Objectives are decent
+A variety of game modes
+Co-op, always a plus for me
+You can play as zombies too
+Different characters you can play as

-Has a low playerbase
-Community isn't great
-Combat leans more to guns
-People don't work together in games
-Difficult due to bad teamwork of most players
-Hordes of zombies just seem impossible to survive
-Melee weapons need pin point accuracy to be effective
-Objectives need to be better shown and directed, annoying to have to check the phone all the time

I wanted another great zombie game to play, I like zombie games where you get objectives and have to make your way from A to B. I love No More Room In Hell and Left For Dead 2, I've tried other similar games and now I've tried contagion. I wasn't fond of it, looks and plays nice but the players and combat bring it down.

reviewText:
Pros:

-Different take on a zombie killer is a breath of fresh air.
-Players' ability to be common zombies is definitely another breath of fresh air.
-Workshop support, and by extension, modability.
-To make up for the difficulty of hosting games over the Internet (details below), it does have rather decent single-player gameplay.

Cons:

-Seems to need a powerful computer and graphics subsystem to play, i.e. something more powerful than even L4D2 needs.
-No lobby to gather friends or other players in.
-Woefully lacking network support that other Source games have makes it really difficult to host games over the Internet.  Needs either Hamachi, NeoRouter, Evolve, Tunngle, or router/firewall portforwarding/port unblocking wizardry to work at all, let alone well.
-No Linux dedicated server.  Most dedicated server establishments are built on Linux owing to the expense of getting a Windows license, not to mention the fact that the best place for a Windows system is behind a heavily-fortified firewall.
-In light of the above, the price on a game this modern might scare off others.  Were this in GoldSrc, I'd give it a pass.  Not this time.

A mixed bag, but the best time to pick up this game is when it has a very steep discount applied to it, i.e. during seasonal and special event" sales.  Until these deficiencies are addressed

reviewText:
[Skip to the verdict if you want a short summary]
What is contagion?Contagion is a first person zombie horror game created by Monochrome LLC and running on the source engine in which you play one of eight characters who have to survive in a zombie ridden world. At the moment there is four main gamemodes which are Hunted, Escape, and Extraction. In hunted you experience tense Pvp battles with players online whilst at the same time fighting off zombies and scavenging for supplies and ammo. In escape you follow objectives sent to you via an ingame phone to escape (as the name suggests) the area you are currently in. This is my personal favourite gamemode for an atmospheric horror experience! And finnally: in extraction you have to help rescue Ai by taking them from one side of the map to the other via a Gps on your in-game phone.

The loveThe main thing I love about this game is the atmosphere; every second and every turn is an intense moment. Most of my time playing this game I spend with my heart beating rapidly as I brace myself for a zombie encounter. This atmosphere is mainly brought on by the difficulty which comes from the random infection chance when hit from a zombie meaning any damage could be fatal and also the scarcety of ammo. The maps in these game are truly amazing. The game feautures a system which randomizes the map everytime so you will be experiencing a new adventure with each playthrough. Aswell as this the maps feauture tight spaces and lots of corners which adds a cloustrophobic ephect of if you see a zombie: your more or less going to have a heart attack. Whilst talking about the maps I feel the need to mention the amazing soundtrack and also sound effects used within the game which make up for the mediocre voice acting. These two things combined mean that you will feel as though you are actually there walking through those tight halways listening for the rumble of a nearby zombie. The graphics on this are what I would expect for a game of this type; not astounding but they dont need 4k graphics to give me a true horror experience. Moving on, within the options menu we have a wide variety of options to customize our experience and to provide the needs of those with a microwave computer, which is what I would expect for a non-port. A small mention I am going to give because I think it could be a good feauture but hasnt been used to its full advantage yet is the workshop support. This alows people to make custom maps and zombies which could bring the horror to a whole new level. So far not much good content has surfaced but I have high hopes for the future. Now onto the multiplayer side of things: you can join a random hosted server via a search from the main menu after selecting your desired map and gamemode. This means you can either play co-op or the mode named hunted in which players converse in heart renching pvp battles and fight to the death. I feel this gamemode is a really nice addition to the game but I feel it is lacking some larger maps. The main thing that seperates this game from other zombie games though; is the infection feature. This means that when you get hit by a zombie there is a chance of you becoming infected and being a zombie. Signs of this is the noise slowly distorting and the colours on your screen slowly fading. This adds a really cool aspect of the game which gives you the choice of whether to tell your friends that you are becoming infected or sneakily bite them while they are not looking! I feel this adds a new dimension to the co-op  gameplay. Also if you die during a game you will respawn as a zombie which I think is good because it rids the game of a boring spectator mode. Time to talk about my favourite feature in the game: the co-op. There is nothing more fun then hoping intom a game of escape with my friends and experiencing the horror together. It also adds a lightheartened twist to the game. Finnally I am going to mention that a free Dlc has just been released containing a new gamemode, some new maps, charecters and weapons. I think it is good that the developers are still supporting their game and I hope to see more things like this in the future.

The hateSomething I dont like in this game is theHud though this is mainly prefrence and is not game breaking. I just feel that the Hud feels like some 90's shooter and isn't very polished. Mainly the wapon slots in the top right corner. But as I said tis is just preference. My main problem with the game is the terrible Ai. It is truly unpredictable: sometimes the human ai will walk into walls and sometimes they will do as meant. Sometimes the zombies will chase after you and sometimes they will stare into space. I just feel this ruins the immersion and otherwise perfect atmosphere. Another problem is that the deddicated servers are not very reliable and thematchmaking is pretty appalling. This can be avoiced by sticking to hamatchi co-op like I do. But I feel like I am missing a big chunk of the game witrhout hunted which would be hard to play on hamatchi unless I had alot more friends. Something that is a minor problem is the lack of story. I say this is minor because the game doesnt really need a story because all you really need to know is that you are getting away from the zombies but I just felt like a small chunk of the game was missing for me. Another thing that isnt really bad but some people could find bad is that the game is very slow paced and you are not just running at hordes of zombies with a chainsaw. Im saying this could be bad because some people may expect this from a zombie game. My final complaint is a few small bugs such as when you scroll down the texts on your phone by left clicking: you cant scroll back up. These bugs are minor and can probably be easily fixed so Im not to salty about them.

The verdictContagion is an atmospheric zombie horror that will have your heart beating rapidly but dont go in expecting a fast paced run and gun. A definite buy if you have a co-op partner.

Love:
+Atmosphere
+Co-op multiplayer
+Difficulty
+All around good graphics
+Options
+Worshop support
+Infection
+Free content

Hate
-Bad dedicated servers
-Hud
-Bad Ai
-Some bugs
-No story

7/10

Thank you for reading, if you enjoyed don't forget to:
Join my curator group!
Visit my website![axlshack.wordpress.com]
Watch me on youtube!

reviewText:
The base gameplay disappointed me. Progressing through the game's levels seems to alternate between insta-killing every zombie running at you with headshots from a mile away (this works with almost any weapon, so there's really no point to carrying other weapons aside from using the separate ammo) and being swarmed and quickly killed in tight quarters by either a huge swarm that spawned in thanks to an ending sequence or one of the armored zombies.

There's extremely little in the ways of avoiding/stealthing/distracting and the melee combat has no weight at all (zombies will continue to run at you at full speed while you attack them, so you'll just be constantly running backwards while slowly chipping away at their health), so I never felt like the game gave me any choice or variety.

The netcode was a problem in the majority of servers I played (leading to unreliable combat), the player zombie mechanic is frustrating rather than an interesting challenge, and there's almost no mechanics that reward or even acknowledge co-operative play. Medical supplies or other interesting items that could be used to help other players are extremely rare, and covering/protecting teammates is mostly a non-problem in the linear campaign levels, where you will most likely be funneling everyone, including the zombies, through single doorways and alleyways to be shot/slapped with your gun.

I wanted to like this game from the start, when I bought it on early access, and I love the art design, but it all feels wasted in one of the blandest zombie/co-operative games I've ever played. I don't think anything short of a complete redesign of the game mechanics could get me back into this game again.


EDIT 11/28/15:

I have a lot of changes to make to this review, such as looking at some of the newer maps and some of the content I missed. I'll start on the revisions when the 'Flatline' game-mode has been released.

reviewText:
Contagion is going on the right way for a FPS zombie survival game. From the same founder of ZPS, it's worth to try out this COOP game, even better with friends! One free DLC is coming soon and will bring good improvements to the game. Currently with 5 game-modes (Objective; PVP; Coop Extraction and two familiars from ZPS) and 8 different type of characters to choose; including more than 12 types of weapons.

The maps are pretty well made and I known for sure it takes time to create a master piece like that, each rounds the objective and other paths can change on the area, doors can be locked and you must find another way etc. You must walk around to find the items to unlock the paths and complete the mission to escape and win.

For now, I recommend to play this game with friends, you can check out some populated PVP/Objective servers; but for a first try, you should do 'objective' to train your aim and see all the commands for your first experience.

TL;DR

Good co-op game (8 players and pvp servers with 16); free DLC coming in January 2015 with good improvements on the game-play; new animations, weapons and characters and future Linux support! Recommend to play with friends and truly worth it to buy in this price (75% off).

Have fun!

reviewText:
Bought it at early and still haven't regret it. The game is a nice zombie survival shooter, even though it has it's share of bugs and glitches it still offers a great experience.

Story
=======

The story is a little fuzzy when you start, you pick from a group of survivors and shoved in the middle of a zombie outbreak.  In most game modes you are given instructions through your phone by a unknown individual helping you escape the area but of course you need to complete certain tasks let it be taking out a fire to holding a location for a bit. There is of course a few pieces in some of the maps that hint what is going on, as more content comes out the more players will understand or piece together a story about the zombie outbreak.

The developers have also started a comic series free on their site to tell more about the story. It's rather interesting and shows a bit more about the outbreak. It's worth the read.

Gameplay
=======

The gameplay breaks down to modes  and humans vs zombies.

Mode 1 = Escape

This mode is pretty much the story driven type, as you start the map you will be thrown at the start location , from there you follow the text messages on your phone and complete tasks that will lead to your freedom. However there are a few twists, for one if you play online anyone that is killed will become a zombie creating a hard situation to deal with as they are a bit faster and annoying :P , second the objective path will change each round for example one route will have you go through a gun store to the gas station where the next round will get you to enter a threatre and push towards the bank. This randomness adds a bit more fun and reply value to enjoy.

Mode 2 = Hunted

Your shoved in the middle of a free for all. All humans are against each other nothing else matters, ammo is everywhere as well as guns so go out and murder your fellow humans because hey the world is over anyways. Remember though ...everyone you kill will become a zombie that might end up helping you become the last survivor or could be your undoing and lead to your demize.

Mode 3 = Extraction

You are randomly thrown to one of many spawn locations on the map, you may be with fellow survivors if you play online or by yourself. Your mission is straight forward head to a random location which you will find npc survivors needing help, you need to hold the location for a set amount of time then extract them...just remember the further you complete the objectives the more zombies start spawning at the next location one and anyone that dies will become a zombie and are forced to try and stop you from saving those npcs.

Mode 4 = Panic

I can't say much for this one as I haven't been able to find a room for it. It looks rather interesting.

Humans vs Zombies =

Human players have the ability to use melee weapons , guns , med kits and special items such as bolt cutters and keys to progress their story. Humans also have the ability to instant kill zombies with their melee weapon if they sneak behind a zombie which is nicely shown with a kill animation. Humans also have the ability to turn into zombies if they take enough damage or meet the random chance of luck.....as time passes your screen will become grey and your sound will become very quiet until the final moment of your scream in which you turn into those you have been killing this whole time.

Zombie players are nothing special, they aren't L4D special zombies where they take damage or dry hump the survivors to death. When you think about they are very weak, one shot to the head and your dead. However player zombies do have some abilities, one is roar which allows you to call near by zombie npcs to your aid, they will follow you and also you can give them a waypoint to charge. Zombies can also jump, crawl , break down doors and grab players biting them and giving them a chance to join your rank by infection.



Overall
=====

The game is something different , at times it does feel like the mod No room in hell which is a good thing. The concept and direction of where the game is aiming is awesome however there are many issues such as zombies getting stuck to players abusing broken mechanics such as throwing keys or cards under desks or objects that will force players to a halt as they can't progress forward . The story is also non-existence until the comics came out but then again what zombie game really has the full picture as the concept of a zombie outbreak is always based on the idea of pure chaos and pieces of information which does work out.

Should you buy it
============
For coop = Yes it's rather fun and enjoyable
For singleplayer = Not really worth it as it becomes very dry after the second run.
For PVP = if you can get into the 20 player servers it can get pretty crazy and fun. But if your just going for pvp and not big on coop then might want to wait until a sale day.

Final Remark:

My fellow survivor decided to be a jerk by taking all the ammo for everytime of weapon even the ones he didn't have....so I decided to show him the reason why not to be greedy by dragging a mob of zombies into one room which killed me and then grabbed another mob and fellowed the survivor....the end was rather enjoyable as he finally understood that a bathroom wasn't the safest place to hide during a zombie outbreak.

reviewText:
It's not that the game is bad but rather it's simply bland.   As I type this it's on sale for $5  and it has been cheaper  even here on Steam when I bought it for $3.74   it's also been similary priced on the humble store for $4.    So know that the game has and no doubt will be again cheaper if you're on a tight budget.   The standard asking price of $20 is absurd though and is clearly priced high soley to make it appealing during large Steam sales.

The game has two major modes.  One being a Co-op where you have to advance through the map doing objectives while trying to not become zombie lunch.  This mode is the best the game has to offer but it's not great.   The generic gameplay  gets old quite fast so hopefully whomeever you are playing with (and god help you if you actually bother to play alone) better be a rather amusing friends.   Otherwise once you play a map once there is little reason to ever play it again even though objectives are  somewhat randomized each time.     The game is terribly easy except if one of you actually manages to die.   If that occurs they get a few zombie lives and  this is where diffaculty steps up, player zombies are a actual threat and likely your team will be wiped out due to them in many cases.   This also causes trolls to get themselves killed to disrupt the game as early as possible.  These types of players are not overly common but do exist.

Then there is the PVP mode which is just god awful.  It mostly consists of players trying to camp  and a few being brave enough to hunt the others down.  The phone can be used as a method of  playing hot and cold  which will give away other players positions.  Why do you have the numbers of everyone you are trying to hunt? Who knows, but while this may sound like a neat feature it also serves as a warning to the camper that the threat is coming.    Again with the majority of players prefering to camp this causes the brave hunters to often die because killing 4 campers one after enough tends to get you shot a few times during the fire fights.  It's a terrible game design.   Likewise however if you die you become a zombie and can try to get some  brain flavored revenge.... or cheat...  You see the game has another issue when friends play together it doesn't take long before they realize the zombie can help their buddy human.   So lets say the human is camping in a room with 1 entrance  the zombie can sit just outside and call NPC zombies to gather keep calling them keeps the zombies with him making  a zombie protective shield  for thier friend and attacking any player that comes and you'll know their coming because they will no doubt be using the noisy phone.

Beyond game-play  the sound is generic, and the graphics are heavily aged because they decided to go with the Source engine.  A great engine sure even more so in its prime but we see other indie games looking better or having unique art styles to comensate this just once again decides to be bland.    There are just too many games today to choose from that do this genre better, some of them even free like No More Room in Hell.   So there's no reason to buy this game at the end of the day.   You're reading this review during a sale right?  You can do better for your $5.

reviewText:
How often you died because your team doesn't help?

Here you can have your revenge!

This one a blast if you want some serious zombie shooting and/or human hunting. Really decent game modes and well made maps, offering PvE, PvP, Coop and also Local-Coop!
Yes, Local-Coop!

Good graphics & sounds & atmosphere.

Active community including communication with the developers.

For the price you'll get lots of content and you will never be forced to pay for upcoming new content. Pay once and enjoy the full package! More content and features in progress, so it won't get boring next week.

reviewText: I don't think I need to repeat everything that about 5,000 people have said about the game. I guess to put it in short form, don't expect anymore future updates in the near future and the overall player base is pretty low, but you can play it in single player if the player base were to suddenly disappear. It's still pretty fun and is an interesting take on zombies, but there is no way anybody would recommend Contagion for full price since the amount of content is way too low to even consider it. For $5 or less, I'd say go for it.

reviewText: This game is so very difficult and cruel. Best to host your own game and disable player zombies, or you will fail, fail and fail again. With the right players it's very fun.\n\nThe game is highly objective based co-op in the vein of Payday, and it's also a bit like l4d, but a bit more in the survival sim genre. Ammo will run out if you try to kill everything. Death is permanent; there's no revivals or respawns to see here. It's not always clear where to go; you have to figure it out, and the map will change each time. One map in this game is as long as a whole l4d campaign. If you fail, you start over from the very beginning. Did I mention it's hard?

reviewText: Many of my friends and I are into zombie co-op games, so naturally Contagion is one of the titles which we would try on. Before I begin on descirbing the game itself, the first thing I would like to mention is that the number of people on my friend list who has the game, which is 21, is higher than the number of total players currently in game at the time I am writing this review. So, unless you can find yourself a good team (this is an 8 player co-op zombie killing game), please be prepared to face zombie hordes yourself. There will be one or two players in certain servers, but they will most likely leave half way or rambo about and turn into a zombie before you can realize what is going on. You will be real luckly if you can meet a quality player or two in any server. Truth to be told, this game has seen better days in terms of player count.\n\nThere are some merits to the game itself. First of all, as a realistic zombie apocalypse co-op game, the game is rather well-made, graphically speaking. The game itself uses the source engine, so expect something along the line of Left 4 Dead. The game mechanism is rather simple and bare, so as to make sure that you don't get too much on-screen help. There will only be a health and stamina bar; you can carry 4 items of all types, some essential in solving in-game quests; you will only be able to see the silhouettes of items when you go near them. Realism, so yes, that's all you get. The enemies are simpler as well, as there will only be two types of zombies, one the normal ones where you can kill with a bullet in the head, if you are able to place it there accurately that is. The other is a riot police" zombie

reviewText:
OverviewGameplay: 4/10
Sounds: 6/10
Multiplayer: 5/10
Graphics: 7/10

Pros & Cons- Average/poor character animation
- Lack of weapon selection
- Poor character voice acting
- Not many active players
+ Good NPC voice acting
+ Different routes on the same level enable high replayability
+ PvP is a fun mix of cat & mouse

ConclusionHard to believe the team that made the renowned Zombie Panic: Source mod for Half Life 2 also made this disaster. Contagion tries to combine co-op and versus simultaneously, which on paper sounds great but is executed horribly. With player zombies zig-zagging and crouch spamming to dodge bullets combined with the abhorrent net code, versus is a chore. Sadly co-op gets old fairly fast as well.

5/10

reviewText:
-Review for release version-

First off, I have no idea why this is getting so many negative reviews.  This game is hands down one of my favorite video games *ever*, and not without reason.  I'll split this review into three sections:

The Co-op Game Modes

Co-op is IMO, one of the weaker aspects of the game, but even then manages to be pretty good, if co-op is your thing.  Extraction is my favorite of the two team modes, where you must find survivors hiding in their homes, defend them from zombies, and get them to the edge of the quarantine zone.  The sheer number of zombies pressing in on whatever stronghold you happen to be in is enough to cause panic at the worst of times.  Add the zombies ability to climb into the mix, and often you'll watch a friend as a hungry mouth stretches through a window to bite him.

The NPC survivors are admittedly not the brightest, but it's nothing game breaking.

PVP- The Hunt

I know that Contagion is primarily marketed as a co-op game.  Do yourself a favor, and play the pvp.  It's the best.  Playing with friends makes it better than the best, weather you team up and destroy the opposition, or just save a bullet for them.  The gamemode is last man standing, with players scavenging for weapons and ammo while hunting each other and avoiding the undead.

This mode is a beautiful mix of stealth and combat, chasing and hiding.  Each weapon has it's own niche, and even the weaker ones are often so cool that you can't help but use them.  You are forced to make choices on the fly as you hunt your prey, but do your best not to be trapped by the roving hordes.  Any gunshot alerts the dead to your location, and players can easily deduce it too by watching the movement patterns of the horde.

Headshots are always an instant kill, with the exception of the sig, which is an instant kill 90% of the time.  Choosing between spraying with your assault rifle or taking a careful shot with a crossbow to avoid making noise is the lifeblood of this game.

General gameplay

I struggled not to mention most of this stuff throughout the rest of this review, as it factors into everything else.  Too make it short and to the point:

Melee- Simply amazing.  Swings take chunks out of zombies and snap their bodies in the direction of your blow.  Make sure to aim for the head.  Against players, one hit is usually enough to down them, but it's difficult to get in close.

Gunplay- Each gun has a perfect feel and balance based on it's type.  Admittedly, in the beginning I thought the hit detection was off, but then I realised the the recoil has more of an effect than I realised.  Taking your time for that perfect shot is super-satisfying.  Again, zombies lose chunks of flesh, skull, and brains as you shoot them.  You can even blast their legs off.

Explosives-  Deserves a seperate section, despite having only two tools, the grenade and the IED.  Both are VERY powerful, in a good way.  If you aren't careful, you'll end up killing yourself.  Zombies caught in the blast will often lose their legs but survive, so watch for crawlers.

Gore-  As mentioned multiple times before now, the gore is exactly what a zombie game should have.  Skulls break, arms are chopped off, legs get blown into nothing.  As of the latest update you can even decapitate zombies.

Rating- 8/10, only critisims are that the game needs more maps, and slightly better co-op.  You will not regret buying this game.

reviewText:
After almost two years and over 200 hundred of hours of gameplay, I can not recomend this title to anyone else. The community is mostly dead and many of the things promised by developers have not been added. I do enjoy this game at times, but your hard earned money would be better spent on a game that has a community and developers working on it.

Graphics are generally smooth, there is a small choice of weapons that can be very glitchy at times, players like to troll by becoming a zombie, inconsistent nerfing of zombies, and much more.

Overall, besides the levels being somewhat random in the pathing, there is nothing else you will be missing here. I bought this game for a dollar when it first hit the scene, I suggest you wait for a sale of the same magnitude. This game is definately not worth 20 dollars.

There are other zombie games worth the twenty, save it for them.

reviewText:
I have thoroughly enjoyed this game so much that I wanted to write a review. Let me start off by saying there are PLENTY of zombie titles on Steam for around the $20 pricetag, except none of them deliver as much as Contagion does. This game is so much fun to play, even if you decide to play escape mode alone, it's still a blast to play.

This is my go to zombie game every time. The graphics are great, I have no complaints there. They really do a great job in the graphics department. It's just so pretty and smooth. The guns each have there own feel to them, you don't feel like you are using the same gun like in most games. The game modes are some of the best, you can play escape mode which is more objective and obviously you do the objectives to get to the end to escape. The best part is its all randomized so you never play the same objectives and can throw you for a loop just when you think you know what to do. There is Hunted mode which is PvP based and is so much fun, there aren't any Panic servers I don't know why but I haven't gotten to play that game mode. Extraction is very challenging, especially if anyone died and becomes a zombie, you really have a tough time and adds to the suspense.

The very fact you can be a zombie is huge in this game, they do it right. If you die too many times as a zombie though you will stop respawning and you become a spectator which can really bum you out, Only negative thing about the game is that. I love playing all the game modes however, and there are plenty of people to play with. They really emphasize the headshots in this game, and if you dont you will run out of ammo SO fast and you will die.

I have nothing bad to say about this game, and the developers are still working on this amazing game and are about to release a free DLC to us buyers with 2 new maps 4 new guns and more.

You will not regret buying this game, it is a blast to play.

reviewText:
so, up front this game tries to do what L4D does, only realistically. depending on the difficulty, you can have

A: plenty of supplies/minimal zombies

or

B: you get two bullets per player and only headshots can kill the massive endless hoarde of zombies.

the inventory system does help to promote teamwork as you can only carry 4 items at a time. this includes healthkits, keys, flashlight, and weapons. sharing is caring in this game because you will run out of ammo. the accuracy of most weapons is a bit..touchy, but overall a headshot is a guarenteed kill. just be careful because every hit from a zombie has a chance of infection (server preference) and once a player zombie spawns, the difficulty cap starts to kick in.

because of the accuracy issues of the weapons + the sometimes laggy servers, player zombies have the run of the field and most other players will give up just to restart the round.

maps are usually a form of escape mode or hostage rescue" where the players work to get from point A to point B with certain map variations (randomly generated objectives or closed off paths which force going a different way.) as much as one would thing this would help with the repetitive nature of the game....it doesn't. you'll still be doing the same thing over and over
date: but in a different path. the game is probably the most terrifying when played solo
recommended: but it's also the most difficult if you don't know what you're doing or where to go.\n\nspeaking of navigation
