but those servers are hardly ever populated.

overall it's an ambitious title that tries too hard to be realistic. you'll enjoy it for about a week unless you're a true co op zombie fan.

reviewText:
The game itself has some potential, its fun to play with friends and can be fullfilling to do alone. But the game lacks content. The game could be a good one and worth the money if it had more maps, more gamemodes, more weapons, more zombie variations and better music for background, weapons, environment and zombies.

The game also lacks any form of character customization. If you are not going to put that freedom in a survival game then atleast build up a nice storyline around the present characters maybe even with their own pro's and con's.

beside all this the game can be fun for a little while when played with friends but eventually (around 1- 3 hours) it's get really boring and you know any bush and tree in this game. My message to the creators:
- make improvements to the sounds in this game
- try to add 4-8 new zombie models (atleast), more is always better
- Add new weapons and ways to modify them
- more maps, play with heights like walkways and tunnels. make a scary shipyard with huge rusted boats. make a map that you are inside a giant mall with several floors with shop you can go into and small rooms in the back ect.
- more game modes. if you make it fun to have several things to do you will automatically play a game much longer, its that simple. there are ALOT of modes you could think up that would fit this kind of game.

overall score (5 stars max):
2 out of 5 stars

I hope they will keep working on it and will add in new stuff to make the game better and worth the cost of the game. Hopefully they will not screw their buyers and ask money for additional DLC.

reviewText: This game offers some of the best coop online play. With 5 current game modes featuring Escape and Extraction requiring cooperative team work, Panic Objective and Panic Classic for Survivor vs Player Zombie team pvp, Hunted for Open PVP, and soon more game modes. Each map features multiple paths for the play through and numerious and variable weapon drops. Every week more and more user made maps are getting added to the Workshop and the Developers are adding 3 new maps by the end of the year with more coming next year. The comunity is very active and most experienced players are willing to help new comers learn the ins and outs of each map and game mode. Easiliy one of the best indie games on steam right now.

reviewText:
The game is...okay, by zombie standards. Nothing super impressive. See a zombie? Kill it. Oh! See another? Kill that one, too. Its the usual run-of-the-mill zombie killing fest we have seen on the uprise the past few years. Graphics are a little dated, being Source and all, although Source is indeed a friendly engine, they should have waited for Source Engine 2 to come out.

Animations are very stiff, even for a zombie game. Zombie motions seem generic. Although it could be a placeholer for more intricate animations later on, so it is tolerable. Its small details that are easy to overlook. Glitches with holding certain weapons/items are apparent (Wielding a fire extinguisher like a shotgun, for example, or the third person melee swing animations never matching first person animations, which causes hit registration problems in online play, only. Single player is unaffected to my knowledge)

The sound quality is grainy, unfortunately. The Moans/groans of the zombies can sometimes (about 40 percent of the time) overlap, causing a sound that is akin to flies buzzing in your ear. Most of the time, though, it is drowned out with gunshots and player dialogue. The Player Dialogue, though, is limited at this stage, although there is much room for improvement. Certain situations like finding weapons could in the future have callouts (Like Hey

reviewText:
Early access had me interested because I was pretty skeptical at first. ZP:S was something I had a personal disdain for, but playing this back when it first got EA'd had me pretty well hooked. Then I stopped, couldn't really find occupied servers that didn't have 300-400 ping, and overall got pretty annoyed with exploits that left me DED.

Came back recently to see the new DLC and maps, still wasn't all that blown away, or even entertained. Would be alright if zombie players didn't crouch-spam their way to victory, or even had people to play with. Not even my friends want to bother re-installing it.

Oh well.

reviewText:
My review for this  game a while ago was far better and intuitive than this one is.
But that is because Ive had this game since day 1 and it was A MAZING when it was released. Im not kidding, the whole concept of a ultra-realistic permadeath zombie game was fun (Dont you ♥♥♥♥ing mention DayZ. We dont talk about DayZ.). Thats what this game was advertised to be in the first trailer.
Now all I see is a game that is using new updates and content to try to revive a community that they failed halfway through their Early Access period. Seriously. Lack of content, udpates, and everything. I supported this game even after that happened but nothing has changed since then but content amount. Yes, this games good with a few pals.
But when I look at this game I just see a game trying to make its supporters forget the fact that they werent thought about earlier on and I dont feel like I should endorse that kind of treatment.

But to those who do find enjoyment in this game, I applaud your persistence cause you certainly have more confidence in this studio than I do.


EDIT: I've recommended this game to a few friends since Contagion has gotten better reviews lately and slightly more work put into the content. We'll see how it goes. Don't play this without friends, though.

reviewText:
I’ve played most of the zombie games recently available. Contagion is easily my favorite. The only other game that comes close is the Nazi Zombies series.

As an adult gamer, I don’t have much time. I play at least once a week with my friends online. We use a mumble server. Voice chat is absolutely necessary as teamwork is insanely important in this game. You will not be able to run off by yourself and survive. I have a dedicated private server. Which is easy to set up and lets us play without trolls or kids. We prefer the coop “escape” mode.

The best thing about this game is how brutally hard it can be. Head shots are the only practical way to kill zombies. Ammo is so scarce every single shot counts. It is common to be down to your last two or three shots with zombies on your tail. You can run away, but eventually you will have to stand and fight. Finishing a level is very satisfying and a real accomplishment.

The levels are enormous, but well laid out. Some game modes do not have a map, so getting lost is possible.  Once you learn them you will not get lost, as most are fairly linear.

The downside is that there are not many maps. The game needs about twice as many maps as it has now. A few people have released maps via the workshop. While most of these are very good, there are not many and few people play them.

reviewText:
I do not recomnend this game if you enjoy Fast Paced Zombie games.

I spent the only time playing this game as a Zombie. The most horrible, boring thing you could do, and it seems that unless you're a very good player as a human, you will be stuck playing a Zombie for a very long time. Zombies have small abilities which allow you to track the other humans, command zombies you've added to your group and such. However, a single shot to your head will reset you a real far way away from players and the footprints that you're supposed to follow bug out a lot meaning unless you have learnt the map, finding your way anywhere is a struggle.

This game really is for the die hard zombie player, if you're looking for a game to pass the time, find something else, something fast paced with an easier learning curve.

reviewText: Contagion is a first-person, cooperative multiplayer that takes various approaches and scenarios of a zombie apocalypse into a video game. Contagion is a sequel (?) or a spiritual successor (?) to Zombie Panic: Source, which is a free multiplayer mod.  Does the game stands apart from other zombie games? Is it worth playing? What about the replay value? Let's find out.\n\nContagion has a problem on standing out from other zombie games. There is no uniqueness or distinct flavor for this game. Escape Mode is one of the most common gameplay feature where you (and your friends or other players) have to do objectives while trying to get to the extraction point and not being killed on the way there. Escape Mode does have a moderate" replay value
date: but most of the time is wasted on backpedaling to an old area to get something or do an objective. This leads to quick boredom and it kills replay value. This mechanic seems familiar to Left 4 Dead's AI Director system in terms on what items are located (along other things)

Good luck on that.\n\nThe main problem for Contagion is that the player population is very low and the daily numbers are abysmal based on Steam Charts. Contagion does have sale promotions on the Steam Store to get other gamers to buy the game (as it was shown in Summer

reviewText:
So I had this game gifted to me as soon as it came on steam early access on sale for $5 around December 2013 played it for an hour before giving up and uninstalling. Recently I got a week ban on CSGO and was looking for something to kill time until my ban ended. I played this game again for about 7 hours of May 2015 and there were plenty that has changed.

Improvements From Early Access:

Loading Times:
When this game first came out, the load times were absolutely horrendous. Taking 2-3 minutes to even load a map and 30-45 seconds to load the opening menu. Now using the same computer at launch, it takes 10-15 to load the menu and a minute at the most to load the server.

Improved AI:
The ai survivors in the extraction mode at launch were basically potatoes. They would follow on command but were unarmed and didn't react to zombies. Now survivors are armed with basics weapons, usually a pistol but I have seen them armed with a shotgun and now react to the zombies.

Cons From Early Access:

Community:
Originally this game and all it's servers were packed from its kick starter hype, finding around a 100 people on 15 servers just on the first tab while I was browsing. Now in May 2015, I can find around 10-20 total in all the occupied servers. What I've seen through steam forums is that monochrome has lost most of its original team, and that promised DLC and kick starter backer bonuses were never delivered. Currently at the moment this community is so small I practically play with tr same guys every night and I practically know everyone's first name and basic information.

Regular Review:
Just playing as if I had no knowledge of before.

So loading this game for the first time again in a year I decided to run a game of Hunted, a game mode of up to 16 people surviving in an open arena until there is one. Unfortunately there was only one occupied server with around 10 people playing on the same map (Aurora States). So I spawn in, the map is a dark zombie overrun surburban neighborhood, and I start with a pistol a baseball bat, and some ammo. I hear the moans of zombies and gunshots in the distance, and quickly run to a nearby house and hide in the garage. I think some of the zombies on the street heard me as I hear the front door starting to break, suddenly machine gun fire breaks out and I hear someone enter the house. Suddenly I hear a player enter the house, because it has irregular footsteps and I hear their flashlight flick back and forth. Paralyzed I aim my gun at the door waiting, as the man is going door to door looking for supplies. Then I hear a crash of the window glass breaking and a hail of gun fire and the screams of a man dying. Probably unaware that anyone else was in the house, he opens the garage door where I immediately pump his body with lead. There I stood, looking at the loot of the two men, with an ar15, a revolver, grenade, and around 80 rounds of ammo. This was the most heart pounding zombie experience I've experienced in a zombie game, including DAyZ Standalone and No More Room In Hell

Pros:

Sound:
The guns in this game sound fast, and powerful but not too much where it overdoes it. The rhythmic beat of the small caliber mp5, to the thundering sound of the remington sniper, sound responsive and fluid.

Controls:
Controls feel semi-realistic blending the arcade like movement of hl2 and the movement of Insurgency is the best way I can describe it. However you can see your ammo count, see a stamina bar, and see your health which makes it more of an arcade kind of feel.

Infected:

Zombies react to noise and sight very well in this game. Run across a street into a home spraying an ar15, and you'll get a horde surrounding you within minutes. Also a very cool element is that everytime a zombie hits you, you have a chance of getting infected, where your screen and sound will blur and turn muffled until you turn. However I wish there was a way to revert it or slow it down like the pills in No More In Hell

Cons:

Characters:
There is no story in contagion per say, but all of your selectable characters have a backstory" which consists of a paragraph description in the selection menu. How am I supposed to even care about these characters when there's no reason to. Also they have no personalities whatsoever and all have the same 18 or so lines in the quick command bar and don't even seem to know each other. Overall worst cast of chaarcters in a video game
date:
don't even know their names to criticize them individually.

Weapon Balance:
The weapons in contagion especially the melee weapons are extremely unbalanced. How can a zombie take a full swing from a fireaxe
recommended: and live but die from 1 hit on a Kabar Knife. Melee weapons are a joke

reviewText:
Good concept but ruined by severe issues (headshots are sometimes broken, you can't get rid of weapon auto-switch, shotgun shells have no cinetic effect, you can shoot 6 shells of remington  in a riot cop at point blank, this has no effect at all... no push back, no impact on gear, just some dmg that you have to stack to kill him).
This is really poorly executed and is just one example among huge amount of flaws.
Add lags and desynchs, rubberbanding in some servers and your day is complete.

Games suffers of major flaws that come to ruin your gaming experience.
Badly optimized, bugged like an alpha stage.

Overall : not bad and original concept but too much issues. The co-op aspect of game is really good and will require constant teamplay if you want to succeed.
That also means that playing with random teams can rapidly become a real bad game, no fun, restart another random s.h.i.t.game, rinse, repeat.. Or better option : swap to fun game.


Anyway, despite the really good idea and atmosphere the game produces, the almost constant issues that I meet ruin the fun.

Very good idea + bad execution = I can't recommend.

4/10

reviewText:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=U9YS1ZB5Bb8
Above is my impression of the game.

Contagion at first glance might seem like Left 4 Dead, but when you get into it, it's actually very different from the L4D series. Rather than a linear map, or run and gun game play, Contagion features an open map level design, and conserving resources such as ammo is key to your success. The game can get hectic with 8 player multiplayer and will involve some discovery by the player to progress through the game. It still has a few rough edges here and there, but overall it's a pretty enjoyable experience.

Pros:
- Open world environments
- Co-op or PvP game modes
- Interesting player to zombie game mechanics
- procedurally generated objectives and item placement

Cons:
- Open world can leave players lost at times
- A few bugs and quirks that still need ironing out
- Zombie game play lack luster after a couple of tries

reviewText: Contagion is a 2011 medical thriller directed by Steven Soderbergh. The film features an ensemble cast that includes Marion Cotillard, Bryan Cranston, Matt Damon, Laurence Fishburne, Jude Law, Gwyneth Paltrow, Kate Winslet, and Jennifer Ehle. Contagion's plot documents the spread of a virus transmitted by fomites, attempts by medical researchers and public health officials to identify and contain the disease, the loss of social order in a pandemic, and finally the introduction of a vaccine to halt its spread. To follow several interacting plot lines, the film makes use of the multi-narrative hyperlink cinema" style
date: popularized in several of Soderbergh's films."

reviewText: I bought Contagion while it was in beta and for a beta, it was pretty darn good. However, as a game that is labeled finished
date:
this game is seriously lacking. Not much about it has changed. The character models have sure gotten uglier and it seems that the controls aren't too smooth. These are not game breaking, however.
What this game DOES do a good job at is atmosphere. If one is looking for an apocalyptic simulator, this is probably your best bet. It's actually got the concept down more solid than Day Z has.
Because this game is an Indie game, I can totally forgive the fact that this game is not perfect. But, as more people invest into this project, I'm sure it will be up to standards with other popular titles such as Left 4 Dead or Dead Island.
Another thing about the game is that it is a bit challenging in the sense that you  MUST  conserve ammo. The zombies in this game are attracted to light and sound and in some instances, you must choose between fight or flight, which I personally think is pretty awesome; it's been a while since any zombie game makes my fingers twitch with anxiety. In other words, this game is really not for people that crack under pressure. Even on Normal difficulty, you can die very very easily if you are not paying attention.
Becoming infected is a very nice feature in this game. I don't think too many zombie games have that option where your player dies and comes back as a zombie. Getting attacked by an infected gives you a chance to become infected as well. (Although, I'm not exactly sure of the infection rates. From what I notice, some of the zombies are more bloody than others.  I'm assuming the bloodier zombies are the ones that infect you- should you come in contact. )
To be successful in this game, communication is absolutely necessary. As there are no maps for some modes, you must rely on your teammates' directions or your phone's objectives (which unfortunately is sometimes vague.) Mics are strongly encouraged, especially in Escape modes. Campaigns are randomized so each playthrough is different. Granted, you begin to remember the maps once you start playing a lot, but even the items switch around too which can make finding keys or bolt cutters (what ever your mission requires) very challenging, especially if you are the last man standing with your infected teammates commanding hordes  against you.
This game is lacking in some aspects, as mentioned before and should not have been released from beta. Despite this fact, it is still a very fun game to play with friends and the atmosphere makes that setback forgivable (Plus, $20.00 is really not that hefty a price.) Even though I admit this game is far from finished, I believe it is still worth playing. The more people support this game, I'm sure the devs will gradually add more content.
But for now, I'd like to pretend this game is still a beta. :)  Don't buy this game if you are not a patient person.

reviewText:
I'm surprised at how well the features have been implemented into this game! It took me quite some time to pluck up the courage to buy it and I'm not regretting it. The game looks good and plays well, there's plenty here for you both offline and online. Being able to control the horde as a zombie is a big plus!!!

The level design is pretty impressive both gameplay wise and art style! And the game boasts some great shaders at work, game really looks great!

My only real crits are:
Melee attacks feel very slow and restrictive.
Some game modes once the ai zombies have been cleared out of certain areas the game can feel empty.
No Soundtrack DLC (I know there's not much music but I'm really in love with the main menu and loading music, would buy!).

The game is often on promotion and its worth picking up fo sure!

reviewText:
I think in my opinion this game isn't worth £15. This game still suffers from a few problems even though there are some fun bits in this game.

I mostly played the Hunted mode because i enjoyed it the most. Hunted mode is where you go around and try and kill other survivors. If you die then you become a running zombie and try and hunt other survivors. But as soon as it comes down to the last few survivors, it becomes a game of hide and seek. which on a very large map can get very annoying.

I found some glitch spots where you can not get hit from zombies and stay hidden throughout the match. Even some hidden spots where the zombies night vision cant see you.

I find that people who start with a SIG than the 1911 have the advantage becuase of the longer clip size and that finding ammo for the SIG is easier than the 1911...or maybe i just suck with the 1911

There isn't many maps on this game. Even though the items and map changes a bit each round. I find that it isn't enough for a game that costs around £15.

its an okay game but It just needs some fixes and more content. If you're a zombie lover then you'll proberly like this, but i'd give it a miss.

reviewText: When I first saw the project several months ago, I was very excited about its release.  After purchasing it for $5, I feel the price represented the game accurately, about what you'd expect to see in a gas station bargain bin.  A bunch of my friends that play l4d2 purcahsed it during the same steam sale, and we played it togeher once for less than an hour. We tried it again a few days later but couldn't stand more than 10 minutes of it.  When over 12 people all quit a new game that quickly, a consensus has definitely been reached.  We never made that mistake again.  The lack of details in the graphics and the overall gameplay makes it feel like a graduate student's final project.  The screenshots on the store page are very flattering.  It had some great ideas, but last generation graphics combined with confusing gameplay and lack of features and maps killed the game.

reviewText:
If your looking for a true zombie game this game is for you! This game does use common sense. Such as i have bolt cutters so now i can use it to cut locks. Game does require team work, without teamwork, your team will slowly die off. Ammo can be used quick so only use it when you need too. Can only kill a zombie one way in this game, 1 bullet to the head, or a melee attack to the face. This game was really enjoyable playing with your friends. Cons

reviewText: Me and my flatmates used to play this game for hours almost every night. We regarded it as the best zombie co op game ever apart from the occasional crash and all was well. Go to play it again after the last few updates. OH MY GOD. What the hell have you done to this game? It now crashes constantly to the point where it's unplayable, the characters now swing their guns all the way from side to side when you look around, which really puts you off - not to mention. THE AIMING. It takes a full second just to point your gun, so basically by the time you're aiming at something other than the floor/ wall and pulling the trigger, the zombies are already gangbanging your face. If you switch weapon while shooting and then switch back to that weapon the game crashes. The zombie ai is now so ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ that half the time they either don't notice you whatsoever or run in the opposite direction. The revolver is now an utterly pointless piece of junk - it aims slower, shoots slower and reloads even slower. The textures are all bugged out (mostly on the high graphics settings) and basically, the game no longer runs smoothly or even really works. I feel sorry for all the people who paid full price for this, but at least we only paid $5 on sale. Even so, I feel ripped off, and thoroughly depressed. At least I got in over 100 hours while it was still a good game, but seriously devs, you suck. You ruined this game, absolutely ruined it. I miss it. I miss wasting hours doing headshots and pretending it's the apocalypse with my friends, and I want that back. :'(

reviewText: The most underrated zombie game on steam.\n\nContagion is an excellent zombie survial FPS which is fun and requires skill. I was very supprised by the amount of negative reviews for this game is it defientley worth around £10 for the hunted game mode alone. The other game modes are a bit hit and miss, however hunted is a unqiue multiplayer experience which should be played by anyone who is a fan of zombie survial games. In addition I would even go as far to say Contagion has provided me with more enjoyment than more popular games such as Left 4 Dead due to the rewarding gameplay and zombie being a much bigger threat. The graphics are also defientely worth mentioning, when playing on max settings it is amazing how impressive they are. The best looking game I have ever seen on the source engine by far. Don't get me wrong the game isn't perfect but it is definetly a 7 or 8 out of 10 (Especically for steam summer sale price of £3.75). A must have for fans of the zombie survial genre don't be put off by the negative reviews.

reviewText:
I tried to like this game; I really did. I bought it and convinced my friends to do the same. I'll detail a bit about it below:

The premise is pretty cool - imagine a L4D where saving bullets matter and your friends become zombies when they die. The lack of ammo becomes a bit tedious at times; but it didn't really bother me too much. We found it to be annoying that your zombie friends keep respawning over and over, though.

There are not very many people online - its not fun trying to find a game.

Replayability is basically zero - this game gets repetetive FAST. I'm talking everyone-got-bored-before-we-even-finished-the-first-game fast.

everything is a bit clunky - guns dont feel right when you are shooting them and core mechanics feel cheap. Graphics are not very good, AI is no good, zombie mechanics are a bit dull, and the game is just overall below average in pretty much every day.

good idea; bad execution. I would not recommend this game to anybody. Sorry boutit

reviewText: This is a decent game with a lot of potential but in its current state, its pretty bad. Playing solo can be fun but thats about it. The multiplayer is stupid, its fun until people start getting turned to zombies. Then they stop you from going anywhere and the fun is sucked out. Its like a play on left 4 dead that didn't work. Infection is about the dumbest thing in the game. You get hit once and you have a chance to be infected, with no way to cure it. The Server system in the game is also pretty broken. You try to connect to a server and it could give you a variety of errors. Not to mention there is no way to tell what difficulty you are joining on unless you specified for a certain one. Maybe in the future this could be a good, enjoyable game with friends or alone. But as of now, Its not great.

reviewText:
This game promises way too much, and it doesn't look like they are gonna deliver anything better than this unpolished game.
It says 'unique characters', but for me they look all the same. The few lines of 'background story' to each character is everything you get.

In the trailers, they NEVER mentioned that we are gonna get small confined maps full of zombies that can spawn just from anywhere, and only a handful of 'survivors'.

In a co-op mode, there is no storyline. Just random situations in the same ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ maps.
just a 'go here, find this, go there'-like objectives. Firearms are limited and zombies come at you in endless numbers. It's the same ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t every round.
They say 'Every round is unpredictable' ; well that's not true.
You run around, fight zombies by unrewarding and boring fighting mechanisms, and you get to the end 'somehow'.

Perhaps they wanted to make a zombie sandbox game. I thought that's what this could be. I was wrong.
As mentioned, the maps are small. Each map is EXACTLY the same every round.

In a deathmatch game, those with best camping skills are rewarded.
If you walk around fighting zombies, guys will come after you and kill you. One blow from a zombie is enough to make you into a zombie. Better you camp with your back to the wall, and wait for the brave freeroamer to come in and get killed by you.

I can see what they wanted to make. In their imaginations, this was the best realistic zombie simulator.
But it's mediocre, really. I'm a zombies game fan, and I know that 'Left 4 Dead' is an unrealistic, arcady and funny game with running zombies. But it had at least enough variation - even without that 'completely unpredictable' ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t - to keep me entertained for many many hours.

I can see they tried. But Should that be enough? I don't think so. I won't say don't buy it, but don't believe what they promise. Keep down your expectations. You won't need them.
But all the features that could have been good, are only half done. And I really don't believe that it's gonna be any better.

reviewText:
PERSONAL RATING 7/10
RECOMMEND FOR CERTAIN PLAYERS BUT NOT ALL, READ CAREFULLY!

Contagion is the closest thing to being the game equivalent of traditional “George A. Romero” Zombie apocalypse…or max brooks zombie survival guide setting…or the walking dead…you get the picture. Slow, hard to kill…zombies. My review will touch on aspects I feel focus on the strengths and weaknesses of the game. There are plenty of both trust me.

GRAPHICS AND ATMOSPHERE
-the good-
The visuals serve well on initial playthroughs. I honestly felt helpless and weary what could be around the next corner. The stark contrast in environmental lighting made good use of my flashlight. All of it  makes a trigger finger really twitchy. Weather changes with rain in some maps adds nice ambience too.

-the bad-
My only complaint that the exterior parts of some maps lack of variety, changes in lighting in procedural sort of way could remedy this. Much like the ever changing maps on each walkthrough can stir up silent dread awhile longer. After my first 10 hours or so even on solo play-throughs, the fear diminishes pretty quickly.

PVP GAMEPLAY
-the good-
By far the strongest aspect of the game, players will be served PVP modes on ALL game types. Died as a survivor during escape or extraction mission? No worries, you’ll always have a guaranteed turn as the member of the undead. Cut loose and wreak havoc and fear on your friends and enemies.

The game mode Hunted, is specifically catered to this. You can start a game with a group of survivors or a player controlled zombie. Gunning, mauling, and devouring each other till the last man standing wins. Of course, even if you’re killed it’s only the beginning.  Zombie gamplay is present in this mode as well.

Even though I fall in the lets say…..%10 of the gamer population that does not enjoy pvp, I’ve actually had fun…given that the company wasn’t too obnoxious or a bunch of hate mongering trolls. Mind you this pleasant experience only occurred once in my 24 hours of total game play. But hey…if you enjoy trash talkin and ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ some one off over the mic or text.…this game definitely for you.

-the bad-
Now for the downsides…. If you’re not big on player versus player….you’ll hate this game. A gratifying experience is slim. The best way to try to enjoy this of this is to wrangle up a group of friends and some how make a private server.  Even that’s not STRAIGHT FORWARD OR FREE, AS IT SHOULD BE.


CO-OP GAMEPLAY

-the good-
When surviving with friends (and at very rare times random players) that have a good sense of teamwork, CO-OP in contagion is tense, gory, and suspenseful  fun!  It requires a lot more thought and planning. Running in with guns blazing has its place but doing it all the time will doom yourself and your fellow survivors….which in most circumstances you DO NOT want…trust me. I admire this pacing cause it’s more of a thinking man’s game.
When player synergy is possible reaching extraction points and claiming victory is quite gratifying in a “high five” sort of way.

-The bad-
9 times out of 10, your co-op mission will fail when joining public games.  Too many things can go wrong such as….
-Having to deal with being lost for long periods of time if joining mid game
-Players that join mid-game as zombies can quickly spoil your chances of survival
- Uncoordinated player survivors will slow progress to a crawl.
-Confusing or vague clues for reaching the next objective

The pvp aspect has too much of a presence in co-op gameplay, even if you create or join a server that disables the “infection” or “player zombie” feature. Once you’re dead…you’re out. There should be a optional “left 4 dead” feature that appeals to PVE players, such as being incapacitated into a “bleedout” status.

Other players could be allowed a window of chance to aid comrades to their feet when health is depleted, at least for a limited amount of times before death. This would give a nice set of balanced options for PVE and PVP, more appealing across the board. At the moment this game unfairly leans to the latter.


SOLO GAMEPLAY

-the good-
If you wish to truly experience terror and what it means to be prey, initial walkthroughs of extraction and ESPECIALLY escape mode on your own will certainly deliver…. Most likely only skilled players will be able to accomplish this, and victory is so very sweet when you’re able to run screaming toward your escape. I’ve only been able to pull it off twice in each game mode, but man it was thrilling.

-The bad-
Replay value on your own is basically zero… Even with procedural map generation, throwing yourself at the similar set of objectives the second time around is quite boring and a tedious chore. If a chain is only as strong as its weakest link, this is it… contagion highly depends on group game play to be anywhere near fun or even approachable the second….third….time around. Most likely there’d be never be a forth….

If you really want this game to have staying power in your library, bring friends....and some how your own server.... >:(

MULTIPLAYER OPTIONS

-The good-
Contagion is well suited for those looking for PVP for public lobbies. Pick a game mode, join a pub server and you’ll shooting or munching on other players in no time. Nuff said.

-The bad-
Okay so….
-No “friend only” lobby option
-No direct private server options
-Servers for RENT are available on contagion….
-Free private servers can only be created via 3rd party programs

With aspect like these, contagion still feels like a mod and not a developer’s fully released game. Lacking intuitive or direct access to people not accustomed to modding or pc gaming.

-FINAL THOUGTS-
If you’re looking for a great combination of zombie survival and PVP gameplay, definitely grab a copy.

For players that have a strong affinity for co-op fun and thrills..... should think twice though….if you have a dependable group of friends and a means for creating your own servers, then it’s worth a buy.

If not….stick to l4d2.

reviewText:
Almost exactly the same as pre-alpha/beta/whatever.

Horrible hit detection,
extremely poor melee mechanics,
moderately unoptimized,
twitchy & stuttery multiplayer sometimes,
audio bugs for voices,
a ton of animation bugs for humans & zombies, and more.

Nothing makes this game stand out, gameplay is unsatisfying and dull, and quality is mediocre at best.

If you still think this game is fun, go check out No More Room in Hell and see how much more fun you could've been having. (It's free, btw.)

reviewText:
Contagion is a horror survival FPS game running on the Source engine in which you play one of eight characters who have to survive in a zombie ridden world.

So what does this game offer:

- Multiple game modes, including:
• Escape: Follow 1 of 2 possible routes in zombie-infested areas to escape.
• Extraction: Find survivors and extract them.
• Hunted: Online PvP mode, at the same time survival fighting off zombies and scavenging for supplies and ammo.
• Panic: Objectives (player zombies and survivors only, like escape) and classic (1 turning into armored zombies and taking down others survivors, untill no one left or zombies life/time out).
• Flatline - coming soon.

- Multiple game-modes (including survival, survivor rescue, PvP and more)
- Offline & Online co-op multiplayer
- Encourages teamwork
- AI to play SOLO
- Atmosphere
- Long maps
- Challenging
- Good graphics
- Some paths in the level randomize with each playthrough
- Developers still updating the game with more content
- SDK
- Workshop support

This game is absolutely fantastic if you like horror zombie co-op, PvP, Difficult, SOLO Survival games.

reviewText: This game is what I would consider a achievement from a struggling Dev team.  The Devs are hard at work trying to get the game to fire in all cylinders, and I support them all the way.  I have been with this game almost since they first released it, and seeing the community destroy itself is truly heartbreaking.  The Devs don't deserve to be burned at the steak for doing some of the things they were doing, as its hard to have your work criticized.  The Dev acted not as a child, but as a human being.  I sincerely hope that the game community and Devs will put any hasty feelings aside and start anew with this game.  It really deserves a second chance.

reviewText:
It's a great concept, executed rather well. The problem comes from other players, who will frequently run ahead to either get themselves killed to grief on the survivors (as it's too easy playing as a zombie - more on that in a bit), or just to finish the map before anyone else, often leaving new players lost and confused.

Additionally, it's far too easy to play as a zombie.  Zombies have four times the survivor's sprint, and can duck faster than bullets fly in order to avoid headshots.  Speaking of which, headshots are the only way to kill a zombie, which is fine, but not so much when a shotgun at point blank doesn't even make them stumble.

Zombie players will often simply hide around corners, waiting for a player to walk by for a single swipe - hoping to get the RNG on their side for the infection chance.

All in all, the game has the potential, but until zombie mechanics are changed to balance players versus zombie players, don't get this game unless it's on sale, of unless you have a group of friends and a closed server (or enough friends to fill a server by yourselves).

reviewText: If you were a fan of Zombie Panic Source you owe it to yourself to get this game. It's a spiritual sequel to ZPS, and carries over a lot of similar gameplay elements while throwing in new ones. You've got your standard co-op modes and survival modes, but my personal favourite is the hunted mode, where it's player vs player vs zombies. I haven't seen any other game do anything like this, and it feels really fresh and fun to play. Plus, like in ZPS, when you die it's not game over. Get your revenge on your friends for letting you die.

reviewText:
I have found this game incredibly fun and fulfilling, even with the more limited content available. The slightly slower pacing compared to a run-n-gun zombie shoot-em-up is refreshing as you have to actually scavenge for your ammo and supplies and, especially on harder modes, conserve as much as you can.
If you like cooperative play like I do, the escape and extraction modes are fun, especially if you find a good group of people. In escape, you have to navigate a level with some objectives and obstacles that rotate through a couple different scenarios, and in extraction you locate NPC survivors, hold out for a time against hordes, and then escort them to a drop off point. As with any online game, you will probably get in several games with people that aren't as cooperative or skilled, but when you have a good team it's very fun.
If you favor competitive play, there's always hunted and panic modes. Hunted is your basic pvp, where players killed become zombies and when there's two left, all NPC zombies charge at the two remaining players. In Panic, one player begins the game infected but may not know it for a few minutes, and the only zombies in the level are the player zombies, while the first player zombie respawns as a SWAT zombie. Human players have to kill the zombies a certain number of times, or survive for like 20-30 minutes to win.
All in all, I got the game on sale for $5, and I would say it's the best 5 I've spent in a long time. Yes, some graphics aren't as up-to-date and some animations can be wonky, but it's not distracting to me at all. I would recommend this game even at the 20 price if you think this sort of thing appeals to you.

reviewText:
Reviewed 12th July 2014, full released version

The good:

+ Sticking to Romero-esque zombies, no special infected" zombies that don't really belong to the universe.

+ Basic Gunplay and movement

+ A more grounded L4D in concept

The why and the bad:

- immserion breaking objects placement: Tools and weaponary that seemingly can be used in the game are more often than not just decorations in maps. And there are literally littered everywhere around the map. Fences that act as wall barriers to make you go through long alternate routes is fine until you see not only zombies
date: but other suvivor NPCs climb over them with ease.\n\n- Very bad guns balancing. It's ok if I have to do head shots to kill zombies
recommended: but it's a bit ridiculous if I have to do a headshot with a shotgun in pin point distance to kill them too. SMGs
hoursPlayed: ARs advantages are really only just a higher fire rate for me to spam more bullets to hit heads rather than doing more damage or more stopping power.\n\n- Bad resource management and feedback. You will have to guess how much of a type of ammo you have if you don't have the corresponding guns that use the specific ammo. Dropping ammo for team mates that require them is pretty much gonna be a disaster of mess
voteText: which it really shouldn't be for a game that is suppose to rely on good team work.\n\n- Each co-op playthroughs has no or very little and quite meaningless variant in paths and objectives
helpfulPercent:
despite what's being advertised to you. Randomization of weaponary really doesn't mean much when the balancing of them are so bad that your pistol will normally do the job.


The bottom line:

- The game is fun with friends for the first few times until you have ran through each map once or twice.

- If you are looking for an experience similar to L4D campaign co-op

reviewText:
This has to be the most disappointing game I've come across in a long time. I don't understand how it's gotten positive reviews up until now. The concept is great and the trailers make the game seem that way too. However, once you're in the game, it's just a painful road of confusing modes, horribly done controls, and extremely laggy servers (unless you pay to have one hosted, which I refuse because the game isn't that good anyway).

The worst part about this is the lack of tutorial. You are tossed into the middle of extremely annoying zombies and are praying you remember the controls. Dying is a huge punishment since it spawns you as far away from anything as you can. Memorizing the maps is extremely difficult and if you're not spending hours upon hours of figuring that out, you're screwed.

I do NOT reccommend this game. I had hope it was go ing to be good, but unless you can pay for a good server and have an highly updated computer, you're not going to have fun. They spent way too much time on the graphics of the game and very little on the actual game play. Horribly disappointing, avoid it at all cost.

reviewText:
I played this game for about twenty hours since the sale I got it in 6 months ago.

OPTIMISATION

The first thing I will point out is that the game is greatly optimised unlike most of the zombie games I have encountered recently. I use a amd processor in case your wondering.

GAMEPLAY

its essentially like left for dead with two differences, you can have a team of eight players and zombies are stronger and less numurous.

ZOMBIES

there are normal zombies that can be taken down with headshots and then there is only a one special zombie which is one with a suit of riot gear.

GRAPHICS

I think they look nice for a indie game, textures are great and lighting makes the game look more real

DIFFICULTY

it is actually difficult to complete a map in a game starting off, most games have a infected setting turned on so a single scratch can result in a player turning into a zombie and become a enemy to the other players.

COMMUNITY

majority of players I have encountered in this co-op game are pretty cool and co-operative however you get some rotten apples every now and then. this includes people who hog weapons and ammo and team killers in freindly fire servers who  decide to blow up a pack of C4 in the middle of a group of freindly players.

MAPS

the maps change of objectives each time you play them, there are about 5 good maps in this game for the escape (campaine mode). I had fun completing all of these maps.

MODS

loads of neat customisation mods available

reviewText:
WARNING: THIS REVIEW REFLECTS MY PERSONAL EXPERIENCE DURING THE EARLY ACCESS BUILD 4259
IT IS IN NO WAY A FULL PRODUCT REVIEW AND IT WILL BE UPDATED IN THE FUTURE AS THE GAME EVOLVES

Contagion is in many ways the ultimate co-op zombie apocalypse experience. You have many game modes, you have many weapons to grab, tools to use, there is a variety of zombies, it's graphically superior to many other games, and it's a challenge to anybody who wants to play a zombie game and doesn't want to be bothered by a-holes ruining the games, like they do in other zombie games I could mention (but I won't, you already know of which I'm talking about).

You shoot the zombies to the brain and the brain explodes, you see the bullet coming out of their head exactly where it should, and it's awesome. You need to take care and not waste your ammo because there's few and it's a valuable and scarce resource; same goes with medkits.

There are currently three game modes, one in which you must escape a facility carrying on a number of tasks, another where you need to evacuate a neighbourhood before it gets overwhelmed (and you must hold position barricading and such) and a game called hunt" made for PVP combat. The first two are cooperative
date: although there is friendly fire so look where you shoot. The last one is a free for all deathmatch; the last man standing wins.\n\nAlthough there are few maps at the time
recommended: you can see they are very detailed and won't get bored so easily as there is also a script which randomizes each game making it feel fresh
hoursPlayed: changing everything from weapon spawns to open hallways and houses.\n\nAll in all and even though it's early access this game is a gem and if you're into zombie shooters you should give it a test drive because it may be just what you were looking for."

reviewText: Maps are huge and there's lot of objectives to follow in the best mode which is Escape.  You are free to roam around some of the map but have to complete certain tasks to enter into new areas and eventually find the exit.  Each time you play a level there are different objectives and routes.  Along the way you must scavenge for guns, ammo, keys, and other items that will help you progress.  In survival mode you have to last 20 minutes and can use a nail gun and wood to barricade yourself into a building.  The graphics and sound are extremely well done and the guns feel powerful and accurate.  With some friends playing co-op this game really comes into it's own.  8/10.

reviewText: When first playing Contagion, I thought to myself, Oh a slower left 4 dead".  And while that might be true
date: Contagion is also a lot more.\n\nThe game is still in "Early Access Beta"
recommended: and so far it is shaping up to be quite promising.  My favorite mode is "Escape".  You need to work with your team mates
hoursPlayed: watch each other's backs
voteText:
and... escape.  The slow pacing adds to the sense of dread and paranoia that will hit you while you scavange for a few more bullets and try to find the way out.  The smart phone your character carries provides objective updates and on some modes a map and GPS directions.

Reaching the end and escaping is highly satisfying after the methodical gameplay and teamwork you need to use to get there.  Once more maps are added it will only improve this great game even more.

This game is well worth the price of entry and a steal if you can get it on sale."

reviewText:
This is one of the best zombie shooter games available.  The graphics are great, the weapon selection is good and the survival gameplay is major in this game.  This also has to be one of the most realistic zombie shooters too.  You have to search for weapons, ammo and supplies.  Sometimes you'll have to look for bolt cutters to cut a chain off a fence or a keycard to open a locked door.  Just like in real life you have to conserve your ammo and learn to share with fellow players.  If you grab all of the ammo they won't have any.  The game makes it easy to share unneeded ammo with fellow players.  To survive you have to work together.  The maps are large and it's easy to loose teammates if you don't stick together.  Unlike Left4Dead you don't have indicatators to help find other players.  I highly recommend using a mic so you can talk to other players.  When under attack you won't have time to type.  This game can be played single player or multiplayer.  But if you play single player don't expect casual gameplay.  Even on easy, this game isn't that easy.  Don't let any of this keep you from getting this game.  If you want a zombie shooter that has great survial gameplay and is well made, this is it!  (Hint: make your headshots count.)

Pros
A very well made zombie shooter!
Graphics
Realistic
Good sized maps
Encourages teamwork
Some paths in the level randomize with each playthrough.  If you play the same map again the next time you may have to find a different door or take an alternate path to complete the campaign.
The developers are always improving and adding to the game.  Sometimes they release a seasonal update to reflect Halloween or Christmas.

Cons
Hosting multiplayer - you have to do it the hard way".  It's not as simple as clicking multiplayer and inviting friends.  You have to do port forwarding.  If you're joining a game you can do it the easy way
date: just join or have the game to throw you in a random lobby.\nZombies glitch a little when around obstacles."

reviewText:
Contagion is a neat little game, Best described as dayZ light". If you like the concept of dayZ pvp and loot but don't want to suffer through a "simulator" that requires large amounts of time investment and forces you to eat/drink and walk extreme distances then Contagion is worth a try.

This game also has a coop mode that is basically Left for dead but with more players. Players must get from one objective to another and find gear along the way. One cool thing about contagion is that when you die you spawn as a zombie until the next round. This means that if you are infected or die early on you don't have to be taken out of the action.

The PVP mode is basically a free for all. Everyone spawns around a pretty large map with a pistol and compete for gear. You can choose a building and board it up to create a little hideout.
Its pretty intese when dozens of zombies are trying to bust into your little fortress.
When you die you respawn as a zombie for a chance to get revenge on whoever killed you.
As a zombie you can gather hoards of NPC undead and direct them toward the survivors.

This game features a nice variety of gear. Everything from Crossbows to machine guns and plenty of melee weapons. Also the devs continue to add gear and maps for free.

Only a few nitpicks with this one: Some maps can be difficult to navigate in coop. You can sometimes get lost especially if you aren't sure what to do next. Also some servers have zombie players disabled. This means that if you die you will respawn as a cockroach until the round ends.
I suggest avoiding those servers unless you really hate those pesky player zombies.
Also the population of the game can sometimes die between steam sales and content updates.... Only a few servers to choose from in those scenarios.

Overall this game is really cool because you get the intese PVP that dayZ is known for but without the open-world grindyness or low framerates that dayZ subjects its players to. Contagion runs on the source engine so the framerates are high on a variety of system configs. The graphics aren't anything special but the game still looks great. I give it a thumbs up."

reviewText: Ever want to try your hand in being in a Romero-type zombie world? This game gives you that chance. Theres no special infected fluff, or crazy unloading buckets of ammo into zombies. You have limited ammo with what you find, you are being hunted by human survivors, as well as zombies. They give you a false sense of security that they shamble, but after a few shots fired, they swarm just like out of a movie.\n\nThis game gives you that creepy atmosphere that no place is safe, and there is no safe room, its you against them, and staying still means death. Stay on the run, find friends, and for God's sake only fire when absolutely required. If you happen to find an enemy player nearby, give him a call, hopefully the zombies answer for him =)

reviewText: I cannot say this game is the best I've played in a while, but it is worth trying out at least. There is at present a limited number of options for maps at the moment (a situation I expect to change in the near future), but from what I can tell the map quantity does not need to be high. It offers a dynamic gameplay so that each playthrough is unique. The maps lock certain ways and unlike others each time, which is unique unto itself. The fact that players who die come back as zombies makes the game that much more fun. It is somewhat limited in scope, however. The physics are not as polished as some other zombie games, and there are only two kinds of zombie to face - regular and armored. The player zombies act as 'leaders' for the horde only in that they can command them; they do not have enhanced hp or special abilities. However, the games modes included do make up for the seeming lack of variety or polish. Hunted is effectively a deathmatch with zombies thrown in for flavor, escape is the classic left for dead style run through, escort is the typical escort-style mission with zombies, and panic is a simple pc v pc human v zombie deathmatch mode. Another plus is the survival-style limited resources provided. Every game mode, no matter the type, forces the player to constantly scavenge for ammunition and equipment, which is how one would imagine a zombie apocalypse to play out. Over all this is a decent game, though if you dislike the survival horror genre stay away. Ammo conservation is paramount to survival here.

reviewText: Heh, this is going to be a long review. It is not going to be all-out dissing the game, but there are ups and downs about this game. I know it is in beta but the game seems to be centering around tasks. It might just be me noticing this but the animations are a bit choppy, zombies will randomly dissapear, and the zombie's animations are a bit odd remarking their savage behavior. What I mean is that this game needs more time, I think the game shouldn't have been released at this time, giving it's condition. Yes, the game is almost stable, but I think that if they put more effort into the zombie's animations that will fill up that space. Moving on to the players, the melee weapons are hard to get used to, due to lack of damage, making them complayely useless. This game is relying too much on the guns side. Unlike NMRiH (No More Room in Hell), the melee is actually usefull, the Contagion team needs to add Critical Hits, and the ability to sever limbs. The players animations confuse me between weak hits and powerfull hits with melee weapons. I think that they need to show the player charging up their hit, and then releasing it upon the enemy. If the Contagion crew wants some inspiration, I recommend these games to light a spark: L4D 1&2, NMRiH, Project Zomnoid, The Dead Linger, and  7 Days to Die. I know this review was long and I hope the Contagion crew reads this and might get inspired or get notified of these glitches or problems, I will update if I come across anyhing.

reviewText:
Contagion is a zombie game with a good portion of realism. It uses the source engine and allow us players to create custom maps which I love it so much.

GamemodesThere are many game modes out there but no tutorial so you are better off by watching the trailer first to get to know about the gamemodes before you get confused will all the new features. For example if you had enough with coop, you can play against other players in a level filled with the walking dead.

Main featuresThe main core in this game is that the zombies are slow and they won't die so easily if you don't shoot his brain! This is very important because headshot differs from brainshot here so aim it carefully on the forehead where the brain is located! There is also the infection rate which can be very high depending on the difficulty.

One of the unique feature is to turn into a zombie which will happen when you are infected or when you died. Your new goal now is to kill all the remaining survivors. Playerzombie are faster than normal zombies and can roar which makes the zombies follows you. You can command zombies to different places and the blending ability is a skill that will turn you into a regular ai zombie as camouflage until you stop the blend mode.

Furthermore the ammo and weapon spawns are all randomly located, the same thing happens on some objectives in escape mode too which boost up the replayability greatly.

The gore system in Contagion is pretty well made. If you have a sharp melee weapon you can cut off almost every bodypart from the zombie. If you cut off a leg they will turn into crawlers. Cutting both arms will disable their ability to attack. All the wounds will be displayed even on shooting. You can even do finishing melee moves if you manage to sneak up behind a zombie.

OVER 1000 hours!? WHY THE THUMB DOWN?Because I tried everything to keep this community together and keep having faith on this company for two years, but, alas, without luck. I'm a hobby level designer and created the custom map HotZ and I'm also currently working on another project for Contagion called TWZ.

The development of HotZ took me almost one year and until now it received regularly updates. Seeing how everything is going downhill due to the bad decisions of Monochrome is incredible frustating and sad for me since I invested a lot of time and effort for this game. I met a lot of nice and helpful people when it was still active but now I just reached the limit. Seeing the people who I know leaving one after another makes me very sad.

UpdatesSadly even with all the gamemodes the content seems to be rather small since the whole core team left Contagion and that speaks a lot about the image of Monochrome. The company promises free DLCs but due to those critical hiccups it got delayed pretty long and there is still a lot to do. The good thing is that Monochrome is still trying to kept their promise but the sad thing is that a lot of bugs are still untouched and mentioned regular updates are nowhere to be seen which leads to an big issue with the Community :(

CommunityThe community is much smaller than before and it keeps decreasing due to the lack of updates and communication with the playerbase. There is also almost no support when it comes to custom content. That's why we don't see any map related content in the workshop which is quite a shame. The mentioned community interaction on the forum is just a promotion on Tatsur0's (CEO) twitch channel that has very little to do with interacting with the community itself where it really counts.

ConclusionThere are many zombies games in steam that focused more in action than on the survival aspect and the consequences unlike Contagion. Contagion is a game that has a deep learning curve which makes the game so special...

BUT sadly, the game feels kinda unfinished and filled with a lot of minor bugs. The lack of update with sloppy results and the lost of the core developers certainly crippled the community to death.

Well, if you really wanna buy it then buy it on sale and don't forget to try out my custom map.
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=353212111

reviewText:
First of all, I would like to say that I've been a fan of Zombie Panic! Source, It was my favorite steam game, I've played years of it and when I heard about Contagion I got super excited for it.

In the weekend they put the game for a free weekend and on deal, I played the trial and fell in love with it, After a while I bought the game and I'm not dissapointed, A big thank and congratulations to the developers for making such a great game.

This game is similar to Zombie Panic! Source so you'll get almost no problems with understanding the game's gameplay.

So basically there are various gamemodes and maps, Each map with it's own objectives and each mode with it's own point.

For a start I would suggest trying out ce_losmuertos (Escape : Los Muertos)

From what I can tell it's the easiest map out there.

Talking about the game, You at the start are a survivor, And there are other zombies/infected that are out there trying to stop you, There are many actions that you can do when you are a survivor or a zombie, Which is great and balanced.

The game has some realism, So you'll get tired after sprinting (Yes theres sprinting!) for a while, Jumping and you have no crosshair, So iron sights are a very useful thing here.

For zombies you can roar, Use your zombie vision, Blend (Activate a CPU to play for you) and command other zombies.

If you think you'll let zombies hit you and you'll be fine you're wrong, Because theres infection!

I really love these kind of games, So it's a 5 out of 5.

reviewText: I hear alot of people with negative opinions about this game. Though it is in development I already think this game is amazingly fun, and I'm sure I'm going to spend alot of hours on it. Like alot of games, this game takes just a little bit of getting used to. It may seem difficult at first, or the controls may seem weird(I always change mine to what fits my playstyle) but if you give the game a try I'm positive you'll have some crazy adrenaline filled moments that will have your palms sweating. If it is going to be your first time playing, I highly suggest you play a coopertive mode such as Escape or Extraction. If you play a pvp mode on your first time you might get a little frustrated from dying by more experienced players. Once you have a hang of the gameplay and find yourself a friend or two you'll quickly find that this game could potentially be one of your most favorite games.

reviewText:
This game recently came out with this split screen. Oh god. As of now, it is extremely glitchy. Zombies will only spawn half the time, if both players have remington 700s out, you see eachothers screen, if a player becomes infected, the other players can merge with some of these traits from time to time (ie. seeing the zombies vision ability, and the foot steps) and the list goes on and on. However, it is very hilarious if you don't want to play a serious game with your friends and it is a neat idea, but it just needs a lot of improvement.

As for the actual singleplayer game, meh. I mean, there is pretty good gameplay value, just not a lot of maps. I have stuck with this game since early access came out, and I noticed a major decline in the quality of the graphics since ealry access.

I'm just wishing that the developers would come in and do a house cleaning because this game has a serious amount of potenetial, especially the hunted mode (like a multiplayer mode with zombies).

I recommend this game for people who don't get that angry at BS. For now, at least.

reviewText:
Honestly, this game isn't perfect. The AI needs an overhaul, the Player Zombies are overpowered, and balancing is needed.

But, if there's one thing that keeps me coming back, it's these developers.

They actually listen and know what their community wants.

The game shipped with 8 players max.

Some of us asked for more players, and they raised the cap to 16.

The game came with one PvP game-type called Hunted, pitting players against each other and a bunch of AI-controlled zombies. Some guys wanted the ability to disable player zombies, some guys wanted to get rid of the AI-zombies.

What did the devs do? Both. They released a game-type called Zombie Panic and added toggle options for Player Zombies and Infection.

Most devs keep quiet about their work, these guys don't. They have a list of things that they are working on.

Pioneer Express? Barlowe Square? They told all of us about these maps. What are they working on now? CE_Biotec.

Got a question about the game? Post it in the forums. If it's something that the community can't answer, the devs probably will.

Some reviews have said that the devs ban people who criticize their game. They don't, otherwise I would've been gone a long time ago.

Now, onto the actual review.

This game is hard, and I mean ridiculously hard. That's one of its charms.

It's a survival horror game that forces you to work in order to master it, a lot like the original Resident Evil games.

Ammo is scarce, navigation is difficult, and zombies are strong.

Eventually though, these 3 problems fade away as you begin to conserve ammo, learn the maps, and aim for the heads.

It's a game that punishes you for stupid mistakes, but every time you do something right, you'll feel like you've accomplished something.

It's a love-it-or-hate-it type of game, and it's one that I personally enjoy.

reviewText: Pros: Very tactical. Feels like the zombie apocalypse, with that atmosphere, the ability to board up entrances, infection, and a mode that allows humans to fight each other over resources. Tense, addictive. Challenging, so satisfying, hard won victories. Escape Mode plays like a proper single-player survival horror, but with co-op, and player zombies: look for the way to proceed, find objective items like fire extinguishers and keys, etc. Allows players fighting each other as Humans, zombies. Varied, dynamic modes. Randomized objectives means you can't predict quite where to go, or what to do, even after playing levels many times. Solid co-op, with 2-16 players. Good alternative to Left 4 Dead, which it is a clone of.\n\nCons: Some awkward elements, such as glitches and bugs. Exploits that some players abuse. Players that are zombies are not quite equal to 'human' players, the way it is in, say, Aliens vs Predator. Too little content. Not as refined as Left 4 Dead. No easy" way to play
recommended: and rarely winning does get frustrating.\n\nMy recommendation: Get this if you want an alternative to Left 4 Dead that is not streamlined
hoursPlayed: and even more realistic and dynamic."

reviewText:
This is a game that I will download, play with friends for a while, forget about, notice it has an update and play again.
Every-time I've opened the game something has been changed and improved, whether that's extensive as new maps or as small as a redesigned menu; this game seems to be moving forward.

I really love the multiplayer ideas they have included - trying to hunt down other players while navigation a horde of zombies all whilst not giving your position away is really stressful, and really fun!

As well as this, the Escape maps - where you and other players must work together to escape from the map are really fun and quite challenging sometimes. The only problem I have with the Escape levels is that when a player dies, they then become a zombie and in my past experience, it is very easy for that one player to then wipe out the remaining survivors". I feel more could be done to increase the difficulty of playing as a zombie.

Overall though
date: this game is a great time killer and I thoroughly enjoy it. Can't wait to see where it goes!"

reviewText:
The main game mode is called escape and sees up to 8 players try to work their way through a map full of zombies to escape a situation. The puzzles are pretty basic and usually involve finding an item to open a door or barrier. Each time you play the game the route changes, keys change location, different doors are unlockable/open, one game saw the team using vents to get around the map instead of taking the stairs. The zombies are easy enough to kill but a lack of ammo and limit to the number of things you can hold means that you often resort to using risky melee weapons. The limits on holding 5 things at once mean that through the game you do things such as swap a key for machine gun with no ammo(in the hope you will find ammo) only to find that the armory later in the game is locked..

Deathmatch sees up to 8 players battling it out on medium sized maps filled with zombies. While not strong the zombies are a great addition to the fight. The match is slow paced and it can be quite hard to find other human players, following a hoard who can smell human blood is a great way to track people down. Other ways to find humans include following flashlights, which works great when you see a small flash in the front room of the house next door or following gunshots. Gunshots is a great idea by the developers because at some point human players find themselves cornered in a loft with a zombie they need to take out; unfortunately, unless you have 5.1 sound its unlikely to help locate people that much.

I should point out the game is beta, so there is plenty of time for things to change. I don’t know how being a zombie can be more fun while not making them too powerful for humans. While it takes a while to hunt a human player down in escape mode, this stops the humans getting overran by 5 zombie players. I should also note that while being a zombie was a tad boring, playing as a human was really fun. It was also really tense, death actually meant something to the player and kept you on your toes.
I’m giving this 4.5 stars because I’m knowingly taking part in a beta. Perhaps I would give it 3.5 if this was the finished product, but it’s not. Reviewing games at this stage in their life is perhaps a little unfair, but I think its good giving games trying something new and following the kickstarter/green light/beta business models as much coverage as possible.

4.5/5 stars :D

reviewText:
Escape: If you've played any of the original Zombie Panic: Source modification, you know escape mode. You and a number of friends play as human suvivors (for now) of a zombie outbreak, having just retreated into the lobby of a deserted and overrun metropolitan police facility and you have to work together and make your escape from the building. Along the way you scavenge for ammunition, tools and supplies to help you overcome the challenges of the facility. As your friends fall, they turn into Alpha Zombies, able to sprint, climb, and jump with abilities normally outside the capability of a Zombie (more akin to a 28 Days Later infected, or an Alien in AvP). Able to access some areas inaccessable to the human players, the quest for survival becomes more difficult as time goes, and the number of Alpha Zombies rises and surpasses that of the remaining humans. The escape route is randomized, keeping the map fresh for many play throughs.

Hunt Mode: A well done tense stalking simulation, where you and a number of friends begin as humans scattered amidst a zombie infested suburban community, cul-de-sacs and all, or a quarantine research tent complex deployed in a local municipal park. Each round you must outlast the rest of the players to be the last one alive, whether through pacifist evasion, cooperative efforts, or active negation (killing the other humans Hunger Games/Running Man style) - and as the players fall, they become alpha zombies, just as in escape, making the game progressively harder as time goes on.

Two key factors of both the above modes is that the maps themselves are large (in the virtual square footage sense) and structurally randomized in some sense, doors / pathways open in one round may be blocked, locked or closed off in the next - fires and other phenomenon are randomized somewhat as well - keeping the levels fresh for many play throughs. Additional, resource placement (ammo, weapons, tools), is randomized throughout the level as well - the shotgun you found on the receptionists floor may not be there the next time.

Contagion uses the Source engine as well, so the movement and feel of the game is on par with other Source games I've played, keep that in mind if you're finicky about those things.

My Wishes:

1) While there certainly would be work involved in rebooting and refining a dozen or so maps available for Zombie Panic: Source, I think the effort should be made. I remember several that were quite excellent that I'd like to see make the jump into new & revised Contagion versions, especially with some of the new mechanics granting the classics some new (undead?) life.

2) There needs to be a mechanism to allow unlimited & a selectable number of zombie respawns in Escape mode - sometimes when the randomizer hands the humans a large amount of ammunition and better weaponry early in the map it's impossible for a small number of player zombies (if any humans die at all) to provide much challenged to a well armed troupe.

3) There needs to be voting mechanisms for the usual - key settings, map change, kicking offending players, etc.

I haven't played much of the third mode, Extraction, where you must help Counter-Strike-esque Survivors" (I still call them hostages on VOIP in game half the time) hold out in a house until extraction arrives
date: then escort the survivors to the extraction point
recommended: and then a new house gets chosen with more surivors

reviewText:
Why this game is one of the best Zombie games out there. I'll run down the pro's and con's of this game. First thing up...

-Pros-
1. The first actual feeling of 'survival' I've ever got from a game. There's no crosshairs. There's no mini-map (unless you call the GPS for a few game modes a mini-map).

2. The game is hard. But then again, surviving millions of walking dead people who are trying to eat you, isn't going to be easy. I like that. The game isn't  a cake walk.

3. The game requires teamwork. If you don't work with the living, you're going to end up dead.

4. No OP special zombies. Once you die, you become a zombie. You don't have any voodoo witchcraft that's going to turn you into a magical flying 500 pound zombie.

5. You actually need the flashlight in this game. I can't tell you how many zombie games I've played where you have a flashlight, but there's reall no need for it.

6. Shoot for the brain, not just the head. This also makes it hard for new players, which I guess could be considered a downfall. Headshots don't do a damn thing. You have to shoot/hit the brain. You shoot the chin? Nothing. You shoot the cheek? Nothing. Hit the brain.

7. The workshop is expanding and it's incredibly easy to submit your own work. I've even done it myself.

8. Detail. The maps are beautiful and complex.

9. Not one game is ever the same. The map will change up between every round. On Escape, if you die one round and try it again, you will have to take a different route. Same with the weapons, they won't be in the same place.

-Cons-

1. There could be more maps. There's only a handfull of maps right now, but the makers of the game did say that they were going to come out with 2 free DLC packs. I would guess this comes with new maps. But what do you expect? Some peope complain that there are not enough maps, ignoring the fact that this is not an AAA title. It's made by a small group of developers.

2. Kinda hard to find some games in some game modes. Hunted is by far the most popular game type. Humans Vs Humans Vs Zombies. It's great. But other game modes usually don't have any players. Really hope the game becomes more popular over time.

3. Not enough servers with custom content.

That's about it! Please, don't only read the bad reviews and Metacritic is notorious for giving great games less than great reviews.

This is by far my favorite zombie survival game.

reviewText: Ever wished L4D was less about running ASAP from A-B with magical infinite-ammo pistols & minor punishment for getting killed, and more like a first-person classic Resident Evil with full co-op that wasn't a disappointing or underpopulated mess? Well, here you go! Admittedly it's certainly a niche market and obviously not for everyone if they just want to shoot some zombies, but get some like-minded friends in on the action with a private server and you'd be surprised at just how enormously replayable the (currently) small roster of Escape maps can be, especially on Extreme difficulty. Hell, even joining public servers full of randoms manages to go against the usual online experience and can often wind up being remarkably fun. A game that will sometimes feel a little rough around the edges the more you play and experiment with things, but certainly not enough in any way to ruin the experience.
