reviewText:
If you're looking at this you're probably wondering if the game is worth a buy, 20$ may seem very expensive to those who don't have the luxury to just go out and buy games without a doubt while it may seem like pocket change to others.

Considering this is my first review please take this with a grain of salt.

Why should I consider buying Contagion?
You should buy Contagion because It's fun, it provides an environment where cooperation is key, while that may seem like a generic statement across all sorts of zombie survival games, seriously, in this one, it is. If your friends die they become zombies and ultimately that makes your gameplay a whole lot more difficult because that one player zombie can infect another player and they're count goes up one by one until the last person is left cowering in a corner before she/he is mauled to death by a horde. A lot of players who prefer the old slow zombies and freakish hordes of them will like this game in its entirety.

Contagion challenges the players in a multitude of gamemodes such as...
Escape - Which you could say is the traditional left 4 dead style, Let's go do some objectives so we can get out of here." type of thing.
Extract - If you have ever played Resident Evil 3
date: this is the mercenary mode where you run around extracting civilains.\nHunt - You versus everything else pretty much.\nZombie Panic Classic - If you have ever played the Free to Play Zombie Panic Source
recommended: this is basically the same.\nZombe Panic Objective - The same as Zombie Panic Source's objective escape mode
hoursPlayed: it's Escape in Contagion too but this time it's you versus a player zombie at the start.\nStopping with the possibly ranting non-sense

reviewText:
*Almost* the Zombie game we have all been waiting for

I have played a lot of zombie FPS (They Hunger, Zombie Master, Zombie Panic, NMRIH, L4D...ect), however I have longed for a game that captured the essence of a George A Romero zombie flick. At last we have a game where the zombies can only be dispatched by shooting them in the head! I am suprised this has not been done before, as it not only says true to the greatest zombie triology of all time, but more importantly, it rewards player accuracy.

The game offers a fantastic atmosphere, good gun mechanics and some interesting maps. What stands out from this game is the fantastic 'hunted' mode, which is essentially a last man standing PVP deathmatch with NPC zombies. However, it has a slight twist, in that when a player dies, they come back playing as a zombie. I loved the PVP element of 'Day Z', so this game mode was perfect for me. At present, I would even go as far as saying that the battles on this game are better, because the game mechanics are so fluid and the zombies are actually a threat.

Contagion is by no means perfect though, for starters, the objective game modes are hit and miss. Although the player is told what to do by a mobile phone, it is often not clear what the objective actually is, or where the player should go. The game is crying out for more maps, which I am sure will come when/if it gets workshop support. Also, I am hoping that the developers adapt the current barracading system, so that players can actually move objects (at present you can only place wooden boards).


Overall, this is a decent addition to the genre. Perhaps the amount of content does not justify the full price tag, but it is definitely worth picking up in the sale for the 'hunted' gameplay mode. Hopefully it will develop and maintain a healthy player count.

7.5/10

reviewText: Great game especially for the Sale. The overall atmosphere of the game is amazing, and the PVP free for all gamemode (hunted) is terrifyingly fun. It's like DayZ in the fact that it's you versus everyone plus zombies. Except, when people die, they actually join the ranks of the undead. There's nothing more intense than roaming a zombie-filled neighborhood, breaking into a house, checking your phone, and realizing you're not the only living person in the house. Then you see one of the bedroom doors open...\n\nThe only downside is that it's still in its beta stages, so there's bugs here and there, like the occasional zombie model freezing in place or just a hitbox mishap. There's also only a few maps to choose from. But that'll most likely change as they continue to update the game. It's early access for a reason of course.

- Zombies don't feel that scary". Seem pretty dumb.

I wouldn't buy it for $20."

reviewText:
If you were to immediately become blind while standing in the middle of Walmart during Black Friday, you'd probably have a better time finding where to go, what to find, and surviving than this game. Servers are usually laggy, game has barely changed over a year, zombie hitboxes are awful, player zombies are completely overpowered, list goes on and on and on.
Although you might have some initial fun popping zombie heads, the more you play, the more obvious the problems become. Playing escape always tells you to go hunting for small items across an entire maps like keys, so you have to backtrack for most escape maps, and you basically bumble around for 20 minutes, die, then do it again as a zombie until the round ends. Directions are way too vague for escape, which is actually one of the best modes. The rest of the game mode are meh except for hunted, until player zombies win the match for everyone.

Play No more room in hell instead, it's free and it's at least 78.54% more fun than this overpriced mess.

TL;DR
Gets boring after a while,
zombie hitboxes are broken + player zombies op
Gamemodes are pretty boring
GET NO MORE ROOM IN HELL

reviewText:
NOTE: This review was written 5/3/2014, things may have been subject to change.

This is it, folks. The zombie game that will revolutionize the genre once again.

Straight from the developers of the ever so popular mod, Zombie Panic!: Source, lies this gem, Contagion.

Contagion is the definition of the first few days of a zombie apocalypse. No other zombie games I know of can capture the immersion of an atmosphere so dark, and cold. No other game captures the direct feeling of when a gunshot rings off in the distance, or a scream s heard across the open landscape. Or even... when it's a dead, dreadful, silence.
The use of modern technology in this game is a neat and clever idea, using a smart phone to get info and help you on your quest makes it feel as if this can happen at any given moment, right now.

Now, for gameplay mechanics and good things:

You go up to a zombie. You shoot a bullet, thinking everything will be alright, as if this was Left 4 Dead. It resounds through the area and zombies reply with a big, fat NOPE" as many rush over fences and break open windows to munch on a newfound meal. The sounds in this game are amazing

reviewText:
I would've enjoyed this game if the devs could PLEASE fix the clunky zombie animations and hitboxes:
The way the do a full climb animation over the smallest obstacle is annoying and really just looks plain silly and cheap. Hitboxes are terrible - aiming dead on the head a few meters away should result in a clean headshot, right? But no, that happens maybe half the time. Yeah the zombies are shambling a lot, but so fast that they dodge bullets from point blank range? I don't think so.
And the physics.... just awful, and combined with the poor animations it just looks and feels like an annoyingly bad made B-movie...
Graphically, the game looks good enough, but the exaggerated lens flares are just annoying.

So yeah, that pretty much sums it up; this game is annoying.
It had promise, but was poorly done.

reviewText:
Contagion is an amazing Co-op Survival game that can be highly addictive (in my case). Contagion features Five impressive game modes,, each including it's own styles of gameplay:
+Escape
+Extraction
+Hunted
+Classic (x2)
+Flatline(DLC Bundle/not yet released)
* Escape puts you and other players into the world with an Objective- Escape the undead. It is recommended that you raise the difficulty (if easy/normal) if playing with 3+ players.
* Extraction again teams up the players against the dead to rescue survivors around the map. This mode can be difficult. (play hard with 5-6 Players)
* Hunted pits Players against eachother - but the undead still wonder the streets? thats right! watch your back because once you begin shooting at other players, the Undead will come for you. no recommended difficulty.
*As well as the main modes, Contagion has two Classic modes that are very similar to ZPS. Both are player only modes and support larger servers. The first Classic mode is very similar to Escape but with only players. The other is a timed survival themed mode.
* Flatline SHOULD be a wave based survival.
This game plays well on low preformance PCs, however it greatly reduces the graphics to a simple toonish feel.
If playing Solo, i Recommend playing Escape or Extraction, Just set the Difficulty to its highest setting.
---
I've been playing Contagion sense its beta stage and it has greatly improved, however i've always enjoyed it.
Thumbs up, and post your own recommendations to let others know of Contagion!

reviewText: I just happen to come across this game by chance and thought it might be interesting to play. I didn't have the cash to purchase it at the time but a friend of mine actually gifted it as a present and I was on my way. At first glance getting into the game was quite interesting with different styles of maps, modes, and objectives. My personal favorite were escape modes which is pretty self explanatory. After getting well adjusted into the game I decide to move up to harder difficulty seeing as that was the only viable option instead of doing straight PVP (hunted). Reason being the overall game lacked content so you often found yourself in repetitive situations ultimately remembering specific locations to give yourself an edge versus other players. To my surprise the difficulty was quite challenging however certain mechanics left the overall experience bland if not just right out horrible. Some examples of this were random disconnections, hit-box for zombie head-shots, and the overwhelming powerful armored zombie that required an large amount of ammo to take down if you aren't good at using melee attack (which by the way wasn't an easy task on extreme). Putting that aside, another problem facing this game was the community. Now, by community I mean specifically the typical run-of-the-mill ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s you'd often see in any online game. See, this wouldn't be such an issues however, with the open mic feature and team killing enabled... Well let's just say the overall game experience dropped to below average. You'd often join games hoping to have some fun but run into horrible people that would kill you on purpose, disconnect and reconnect (which auto-turns you into a zombie) to sabotage the team, or have players just abuse the mic privileges by spewing some toxic things out of their mouths. Now, in order to have fun in this game emphasis on teamwork is required without doubt, it is a must or the game becomes virtually impossible to complete or even be slightly successful at (speaking for average players). To put things in perspective, ultimately the game itself will fall into one of these headings for the majority of players either death by fellow teammate, accidental shots (leading into arguments), players turning into zombie (on purpose), players throwing away valuable in-game-items needed progress (by hiding it), player stalling the game when everyone is dead (on purpose) by hiding in specific areas before progressing to far, players mass looting all items which should be shared leading to the teams inevitable death, or completing the game successfully without any issues. In team-based games such as this one, it is important to work together to better the overall gaming experience however Contagion fails to really address these issues thus the problem persist even today. Granted there is a mute feature which is nice but doesn't do justice. So, in conclusion, if you decide to play this game with friends consider it a decent game but overall short (content wise). If you decide to play by yourself, consider yourself warned and tread lightly. The game itself would best be described as a pick-up" game in which you can start and stop at any time with no real commitment towards progression or anything of that nature. If you find yourself in the long-haul playing a lot more (for the competitive gamer) I'd recommend a pass on this game altogether
date: save yourself a headache personally. There are much better games out there. I don't recommend this game."

reviewText:
It's reminiscent of Left 4 Dead if you crippled the AI, slowed the entire game down, and generally made it bland uninteresting. The melee weapons are unsatisfying and unpolished, the audio leaves a lot to be desired, and all-in-all I feel like killing zombies isn't all that fun.

I'm normally not as critical, but really the game turned out like hot garbage and while I'm sure they put a lot of effort into it, nothing particularly stands out or grabs me as unique or new, and certainly nothing that made me want to give it a second chance.

The fact that a lot of the player animations are stiff and relatively hideous, and the voice acting is very unconvincing. Nothing stresses me in the event of a situaton, I don't feel like I'm trying to survive. It... it needs a lot of work.
voteText: 6 of 10 people (60%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Contagion is one of the most realistic zombie games I've come across, I bought it while it was in kickstarter and it hasn't disappointed.

There's many excellent parts that make this game a whole, the UI is really easy to use, the game is really smooth and looks great on high quality, when you shoot a zombie in the head it'll blast brains out of the back of the head which I think looks really cool and you can cut limbs with sharp weapons.

The zombies aren't overpowered but it's easy to die to a horde if you don't know what you're doing, it's a good strategy game in itself because if you're cornered by a big horde you need to figure out what to do, it's intense!

The human zombies are definitely much harder to kill but that makes it much more fun, every mode is great, extraction, escape, panic, hunt, all enjoyable game modes.

There is a minority of people who have given the game a bad review, think of these people as the critics who'm gave your favorite movie a bad review. Trust me, this game is worth your money.

The only thing I can complain about is the fact that they were going to launch a DLC pack in October and it's May now and it still isn't released, I'm not sure what complicated things but I'm sure they have a good reason. they've been keeping the game bug free. You should definitely buy this.
voteText: 6 of 10 people (60%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Looking for a zombie game thats not like any others?
Looking for a well made coop FPS experience?
Well you havent found it. If you have played any zombie game then you have played this. What the dev's will tell you is that the game is complete. Thats a lie. For starters let me preface by saying i play every type of game and strive to do the best at them. So i have mastered first person shooters. let alone zombie games. I know to aim at the brain and im accurate enough to hit it everytime. However in this game the brain hitbox is not the best, many times i have accurately hit the brain only to have nothing happen. Shotguns destroy flesh in real life however in this game they are the worst weapons, they do nothing. This goes for melee weapons as well. choping off arms doesnt do anything as they still hit you with phantom limbs. When you die you turn into a zombie and are pretty much unstoppable, and when you die as a zombie you respawn as another zombie making the game really unenjoyable. You are pretty much a tank. The NPC zombies always get stuck on something or each other. You cant climb down ladders.

There are many problems with this game.
All in all its a bad No More Room In Hell knock off.
With so many zombie games out, this is nothing new or creative.

reviewText:
It's reminiscent of Left 4 Dead if you crippled the AI, slowed the entire game down, and generally made it bland uninteresting. The melee weapons are unsatisfying and unpolished, the audio leaves a lot to be desired, and all-in-all I feel like killing zombies isn't all that fun.

I'm normally not as critical, but really the game turned out like hot garbage and while I'm sure they put a lot of effort into it, nothing particularly stands out or grabs me as unique or new, and certainly nothing that made me want to give it a second chance.

The fact that a lot of the player animations are stiff and relatively hideous, and the voice acting is very unconvincing. Nothing stresses me in the event of a situaton, I don't feel like I'm trying to survive. It... it needs a lot of work.

reviewText:
Really good game for those of you who like zombies.

Great Survivor vs Survivor action, aswell as several Co-op modes vs both AI and Player Zombies.

Hunted - S vs S based mode with Player Zombies aswell. You spawn in a random location on the map, and your objective is to stay alive the longest. Scavenge the abandoned houses along the way, but beware - hitting B as a human brings up your phone, and you and other players can see who is close aswell as get a buzzing noise when hitting the trigger. If you die you will respawn as a zombie and your only task is to bring down the remaining survivors. Last survivor alive wins the round.

Escape - Band together with friends and strangers in this Survivor vs AI / PC zombies. Your phone will let you know what objective you need to accomplish and your main goal is to escape from the map. Weapons, ammo and items will be found along the way. Make sure you check every corner as they are sometimes hidden or you need to progress further to unlock the areas they are in.

Extraction - Survivor vs AI / PC zombies where your goal is to follow the GPS on your map and find survivors held up in houses. Once you reach a holdout point, vast amounts of zombies will begin spawning, so share your ammo and your weapons with your friends, as each member of your team that gets killed will come back as one of the ravenous corpses coming to eat you. Round ends when all survivor packs have been extracted, or the zombies kill either all Player survivors or NPC survivors in a pack.

Panic (Objective) - The P:O mode was taken from the spiritual prequel Zombie Panic! Source, another game worth picking up as it's free, and features a strictly PS vs PZ combat zone, where the survivors need to complete the objectives much like in Escape.

Panic (Classic) The original game mode from ZP!S which just like the Objective mode features only player combat. Survive the zombie rush. Zombies have limited lives and the first player to turn becomes the strong Riot Zombie.

Happy hunting and good luck surviving!

reviewText:
I feel so stronly about this game I hope for the day its developers hire me. I would love to make half-baked,glitchy, bugged,fundamentally flawed garbage and sell it for a living. I tried to give this game a chance but it is so utterly and profoundly screwed up I shudder to think how unplayable the early release versions were. Did the zombies just stand there and pee their pants? The suvivors? was there even a map or was it just some dark abysmal purgatory where the players floated about as disembodied spirits crapping on eachothers shoes?

You got three modes for your money. Escape, in which you wander about aimlessly looking for keys or a bolt cutter or (after 5 minutes) a reason to not bash yourself in the temple with your mouse. Extraction, in which you use your smartphone to go find grown adults, fight some zombies and walk those armed adults to a fence just so they can NOT climb it to safety. And Hunted mode...basically organized trolling.

The only redemption to this game is that you can be a cockroach. I cannot begin to tell you how many times my friends and I were sitting around talking about video games and, forlorned and angry at the world, regretted the fact there was nowhere on the market we could be at the helm of some disgusting insect watching people kill zombies...pay attention Walking Dead there might be a season finale here with this meticuously crafted and fresh perspective on the whole zombie genre.

For those of you who like this game and/or lack attention span I'll summarize:
♥♥♥♥ this game. Seriously...♥♥♥♥ this game.

reviewText:
I would probably not buy this game for $20. Its kind of fun with limited maps and gamemodes but the fps aspect is horribly innaccurate. Would not reccomend mostly due to weak game mechanics. There are no working vehicles, the trailer I watched said that you can throw coins to conserve ammo which is only true if you are using cheats. All of the maps are pretty straight forward (not at all openworld in anysense) and I have not once played a round where I did not have an excess of 45+ rounds for the standard handgun (Not to mention any 3 other guns I might have.)
All of the zombies are the same height so anytime there is more then 5 of them coming at you, all you need to do is walk through any doorway and they will line up for you.

If you want to shoot mindless zombies who shuffle straight towards you in almost a single file line with excess ammo and no need for a team, then this is the game for you. Mindless headshots is a big part of the game. However the guns are really innaccurate. I dont expect to be able to snipe with a handgun but I should atleast be able to hit a non-moving target that is 15feet away.

Also, they have 1 map that is endless waves of zombies but if you arent using cheats, you are limited to about 30 - 45 bullets and they recreated the map from the first nazi zombies. They didnt add all of the furnature and stuff, but it is the exact same game mode and map layout.

I give Contagion 3/10

5/22/2014

reviewText:
There is no doubt in my mind that this game is my favorite! Even after a year of playing Contagion I'm still not tired with it. This apocalyptic gem features a few different levels to play with your friends whether you want co-op or pvp.

Try to escape a police station before the undead horde claims all of your lives, and if you get left for dead come back as one of the horde to hunt down your ex survivors. Take a spin at pvp. Sure shooters can be fun, but when you throw neutral zombies in the mix its not so easy to just run and gun. If you're one for the classics give panic a shot. Trust me after you play it you'll know why they call it that.

This beauty of a game has so much good content already, but it doesn't stop there. These game maker guys throw in some cool updates every now and then to give us new weapon, maps, characters even gamemodes *cough cough flatline*.

Stop hesitating and buy it already. You will have hours of fun playing this zombie infested masterpiece. Totally worth a $20 price tag.

reviewText: Contagion is ultra realistic zombie apocalypse simulation with different modes and game types, like Hunted (PvP), Escape (exatcly what it means) and Extraction (helping NPC survivors to escape). Ammo is very limited, finding powerful guns can be pretty challenging, and the envirnoment is dark, mostly rainy and full of zombies. Graphics are very realistic, gameplay is nice and non-repetetive. It's all about teamplay; as a L4D2 scavenge rusher and soloer, (yea, right) I also wandered off the group and did objectives myself, but usually you can get yourself killed by doing that (yes, in some modes you can get infected from single scratch). All in all this game very well done, and as the workshop just came to it, it's even getting better. Rating: 8.5/10

reviewText:
When I first bought this game I was disapointed. I paid full price for it and I felt confused and annoyed by almost everthing I tried to do. After investing a reasonable amount of playtime into this game, I am happy to say now that I thoroughly enjoy this game. That is why I would really like for more people to buy this game and play it. This game deserves to be more popular. Furthermore, the game is on sale right now so people will be checking it out and there has never been a better time to join if you have considered it. For those reasons I have decided to provide what I think is a good recipe for getting started in Contagion.

1. The first thing you should do is go to start game and select the hunted game mode on any map. Choose solo play, turn infection off, and put the difficulty on easy. You will be dropped into a map with randomly generated zombies and a decent amount of weapons and ammo laying around for you to pick up. Hunted is a pvp game mode and since you are playing solo, this will be a good way for you to just run around aimlessly killing zombies and familiarizing yourself with the gameplay and the maps. Do this until you get tired of it and feel ready for the game to get more intense.

2. Now that you have gotten a feel for the game, go to find game, select hunted as the game mode, and join the first server that pops up. From here you will be looking to find and kill the other living characters (not zombies). This is a lot of fun, for beginners and vets alilke. Since your new, you may or may not get killed early, but thats ok since you get to come back from the dead to seek retribution against the living. Basically you get to play the entire time without having to sit and wait just because you died,

3. Have you made any friends yet? If so, check out some of the escape maps and see if they want to play. If not, check out some escape maps anyway, pay attention to your phone, but dont expect it to spell out all the information you need, your gonna need to figure things out on your own.

4. After logging some time in the game, now you are ready to try your skills at extraction. Try to find and save the survivors, but be warned, it gets intense. Just remember to wait for other players before entering the extraction points, as you will need their help when the hoards start to arrive. Not to mention if you go running straight into the houses without waiting for the others, it kinda ruins the game for everyone.

5. Have nothing to note on the panic game modes since it's pvp and I've never found a server playing them, looks like it might be fun though. Check this game out!! Happy gaming everyone!

reviewText:
Rank: 6/10
Recommendation(s): Buy on sale, don't think this is a triple A title, and live in New York or beside server host.
Major Theme: Significant lack of professionalism.
Bought at Price: $0 - Gifted when $3

There's quite a list of things to touch on, so let's get right to it.

I have always been a big fan of Source powered titles, and even more so of mods going pro level. This title is a big let down, and I certainly hope it improves quickly. To me, licencing and using the Source engine means serious work. The developers are willing to step up to the AAA level and deliver. So far, development has been very amateurish, almost what I would expect from a Source mod.

Being SteamWorks enabled, the download and install process was easy. On launching the game, I was shocked and confused as to why I am seeing a notice about RAM requirements.

This original shows the situation hasn't improved:
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=208377744

From what you see today:
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=248206376

If you are having issues understanding (which is the case with many) what the issue is, please read this little bit. The game notifies me that the OS is reporting there's 4087MB of RAM to use, yet the game needs a minimum 4064MB.

Tieing back into the amateurish development, it seems that the developers can't even do simple math; is 4087 bigger then 4064? I'm not sure why this hasn't been resolved or if it will ever be, but it's scary to think that it has passed through not only QA (quality assurance) but the project lead and programmers as well.

Talking about testing and QA, a recent issue came up of kill reporting. If you were to throw a grenade bound to kill someone, and switch to another weapon, you will find that the server reports back that the person was killed with the actively selected weapon.

I hate going on about the QA, so let's move to another topic. How about effects for show?

Throughout my education to date and programming experience, I was always told simple is best". There's no need to overly complicate things or add things "just for show". Sadly
date: Contagion falls into this trap. What I call the "dirty lens effect"
recommended: doesn't make any logical sense. This effect is used when characters have glasses or a protective visor on. When used correctly it can add that extra level of immersion
hoursPlayed: knowing that you are looking out of a visor. Last time I checked
voteText: none (or the vast majority) of characters didn't have a visor or glasses on. So why include it? What was the gain from adding an effect that doesn't have sound backing? It's just yet another questionable move by the amateurish development team.\n\nI can't bash the game that much
helpfulPercent: because gameplay wise
votesHelpful: it's nice to see some fresh elements in an over crowded and over saturated zombie genre. The cell phone dynamic/mechanic allows for greater immersion
votesTotal: and removes the need for HUD elements. Operation can be odd due to the key bindings.\n\nRescuing trapped survivors was another fresh idea
votesFunny: but again has a failing in it. While they added the ability for the AI to defend themselves
commentsCount: they tend to shoot each other if one is in the line of fire.\n\nJumping into the most worldly debated topic of "PvE" and "PvP" (which I don't agree with the terms) would seem logical at this point. The hunter maps seem to be random
column16: but don't provide enough randomness to prevent players learning the how many different combinations to gain an advantage. I vouch for games that focus on player skills
column17: rather then easy memorization. Sadly
column18: memorization is the is the only skill really required and doesn't allow for fair play.\n\nThe randomness the title does provide in the "hunted" gamemode seems to be unbalancing. Some players are given the more powerful 1911
column19: where as others are given the weaker Sig Sauer. While the round progresses
column20: this doesn't matter that much
column21: but early on can certainly provide an unfair advantage. There's no counter balance to the 1911 early game
column22: because you don't need that much ammo to kill targets.\n\nOn that topic
column23: due to using a certain server host
column24: latency can be a real game killer. Valve tends to spread their servers out
column25: and have enough in reserve to get people playing. This is not the case with Contagion. Either there's an issue with the server host or game code
column26: but you can end up playing on a UK server while sitting on the far side of North America. Not sure how many of you have done this
column27: but let's say 130ms makes shots and server-client prediction interesting.\n\n"Early Beta" for the team was really more of an excuse then a development status. Besides the ambiguity caused by using "early"
column28: it just seems that there was (and continutes to be) a significant lack of professionalism.\n\nSo there you have it. All the major issues
column29: and the unfortunate lack of positives. Throughout the whole review
column30: I keep going back to the idea of "amateurish development". It's the biggest idea that screams out the most when playing the title."

reviewText:
I thought Zombie Panic: Source was a mess. An earnest mess with plenty of chances to grief other players. Such as taking all the ammo in the house the survivors are holed up in and throwing it out the window at the zombie horde. Glitching the door to keep the zombies out of my hiding spot so the round continues forever. Knocking over zombie-built ledges so the zombies can't have any soft, lovely human flesh.

Contagion is a much more developed take on Zombie Panic: Source. And the only reason I've wanted to play it beyond the first moment was because of the Hunted game mode. Hunted is where players fight zombies, temporarily team up to find safe places, and then turn on each other. Or you can play it like I do, which is shoot everybody I see while reading their angry text through a drunk voice. It allows for developer-sponsored griefing, and that's a plus.

Unfortunately the rest of the game outside of Hunted is pretty damn boring and riddled with flaws. The most egregious flaw for me would be the mapping. The mapping is pretty wasteful, having entire stretches of street and all these buildings and not really doing anything with them except using them as scenery. I'd rather have smaller, more functional maps than wide ones with nothing to really offer. What's more, they make the objective-based missions tedious and confusing to navigate. We knew there was a gun shop, but we had no idea where to go, which meant we had to spend ten minutes to locate the shop and then take another ten just to get there.

The part of the game that made me stop playing was the netcode freezing the game. It wasn't lag, but something in the netcode that made the game freeze and wait for the server to catch up and give everybody the game data. This got extremely annoying when I was scoring headshots up close and personal with a zombie horde. I was popping my gat at zombie heads, then my game froze, and then the game told me I had stood there while the zombies nibbled at my gun hand and now I was a zombie. The kind of thing that makes me want to eat my mouse in frustration.

And worst of all: Zombies are still a god damn chore to play. Even with the ability to control hordes, order them around, jump on other players from behind and give them a big old kiss! They are still so damn boring, because you have to find the human players to kill them, which means you have to hoof your decaying ♥♥♥ towards gun noises and hope there's a tasty human to kill. Which is why I kill every human player I see. I say I am friendly and then shoot them, because my bullets are friendly too. They are like tiny little lead puppy dogs.

Anyway, don't bother.

reviewText:
If you expect an easy 0815 zombie shooting game, you're wrong.

There are many gamemodes like Escape, save NPCs, a simply deathmatch etc.
Find your equipment, avoid making sounds and avoid as many zombies as you can.
DON'T GET HIT! It could be over after one simply hit because you can get infected by one hit and then you'll turn into a zombie... is it over then?
NO! You can still play as a zombie, lead a horde of 15 zombies and kill all the remaining players. Now you ask, why should I kill the guys I tried to survive with? Cause it's fun. But be careful, you're easy to kill as a zombie and if you die too often, you'll become a cockroach (simply a spectator). You'll run around on the map as a cockroach, waiting for everyone to die or escape (depends on the gamemode you chose). But hey, its not that simple, players can run over you and kill you even if you're a cockroach.
Theres death everywhere ;D

But it's not only fun but.. the game is dead. Feeling like there are only 50 people playing it. Thats quiet sad cause it's such a fun game :(

PS: aim for the head, don't waste ammo

reviewText:
Have you ever wanted to play a serious hardcore survival horror game online with your friends? Well, you've found Contagion.

Contagion is a survival horror game with zombie virus as theme, and has online multiplayer support, both co-op against the AI and playing against human zombies. Different modes for different gameplays. You can escape a building full of infected zombies and scarce resource, cross a city looking for a safe place, escort civilians out of a small town or even go crazy and play with your friends as humans and zombies. If you are looking for multiple gameplays, I'm happy to tell you the items and the scenario changes, forcing you to handle different threats and unexpected situations. The game really has this aura that brings you into the survival mood. It makes you want to save ammo, to stick together with your friends, to work as a team.

I recommend Contagion. It has a lot the features and the atmosphere of a survival horror, and brings the best of your solo or co-op play. Its only downside is the need of more maps. Most particularly for the Escape" game mode."

reviewText:
This game just simply isn't remarkable.  There is nothing you haven't seen and some of the standard elements you might find in a game like this are missing.

1.  There are only about 8 character models - one for each character you can choose from and one infected version of these characters.  These are recylced over and over making for a stale, non-emersive experience.

2.  The models are all low res and don't have the visceral feel of something like Dead Island or Dead Rising.  Not a lot of blood.  No dangling body parts.  Sorta like the bad painted face zombies of the early 1980s.

3.  The mechanics are a little clunky.  I don'y know how you can take the source engine and make it less elegant but they managed it.

4.  Resources are limited and this is good and bad.  I did feel the need to scrounge and save resources but this was partially due to the fact that standard things you might expect are not in the game.   Example - see all that food in the cafeteria?  You might want to eat it to gain some health or at least some stamina buff.  Nope.  Non-interactable.  There is literally no way to heal yourself - that I found - in the game.  Perhaps there is a particular character that is a medic, which would increase team play, but that is not made clear to you in the character selection if so.  I found no method of healing in the game itself - no food, med packs, etc.

5.  The environment is bland and interaction options limited making for a non-emersive experience.  Kill a cop zmobie?  no ammo or gun on him.  See that knife sticking out of the dead zombie's head?  Yeah you can't use that.  Unlike most half-life/source mods, you can't even pickup and throw any objects in the room.

6.  Stamina system is fine but is pretty unimaginative.  It's a standard mechanic in a lot of survival games now and it makes sense.  But then you have other standard survival horror mechanics missing.  Example - your flashlights have unlimited batteries.

7.  Probably the most disappointing part of this game is melee combat.  You have a regular attack and a charge attack.  While you reel from being hit, the zmobies do not.  Even wielding a large sledge hammer, your melee range is about the length of a small toothpick.   The sneak attack thing is highly buggy and this is exasperated by a really underdeveloped stealth system.  If the dev. wanted this to be a part of the game play, the execution needs to be on par with something like State of Decay, Skyrim, or Dishonored.  No stealth or awareness indicator.  The stealth attack can only be executed when you are directly behind the zombie and this often still doesn't work due to environment clipping issues.

Final analysis - pass on this.  I gave it a try on the free weekened and glad I didn't spend a dime on it.  With so many other titles in the zombie genre that are quite solid (although I am still waiting for that perfect zombie game), this one is rather forgetable.

reviewText:
There are so many interesting concepts to Contaigon that it's hard to imagine how they made the game so un-enjoyable to play. From the shakey graphics, to the horrible weapon control, and most unforgivably: the lack of any direction to the gamemodes, make this a chore.

The only enjoyment I had was on the missions where you have to rescue survivors. In that game mode, the game actually tells you where to go (rather than dropping you in a poorly designed, random, confusing maze) - and there is a nice element of survival boarding up windows and such. But there's only 2 maps for this mode, and the AI you have to save are dumb as a brick.

Worth a punt in a sale, but certainly doesn't justify the £15 price tag.

reviewText:
Contagion delivers a bit of a different and interesting exprience to the co-op zombie survival genre, it is fun and worth checking out for co-oping with friends or jumping on a server solo! thumbs up from me.

here is a rundown of the currently available game modes:

Deathmatch (The Hunt) - depending on which map you are playing the gameplay varies. its basically last one alive wins the round and the dead become zombie which speeds things up and makes it harder to survive. There are smaller more fast paced maps (the park map) or the suburb map which is much more suspenseful and involves a bit of hide and seek (you can board up a house and hide in the garage like a little girl). it never gets too boring cause you can always check your mobile phone which will tell you if people are around you and will give you audio clues about their location.

Escape - an objective based mode which takes place in a prison. the objectives are generated randomly and item placements change so in one play through you might be escaping from the garage and the other might get you up to the roof to a chopper. it is very suspensful and revolves around ammo conservation and team work. the diffculty level could be higher but maybe that's a setting I haven't found yet.

Extraction - revolves around helping NPCs escaping, haven't played it much so i can't really speak about it

If you like first person multiplayer games and enjoyed old school hl2/hl mods that experiment in gameplay this is for you.

reviewText:
Adventures in Contagion.

1. Threw away useless key after needing space for a gun. Later spent 10 minutes had me and my bro-op partner backtracking trying to find the room where the key was, next 5 minutes trying get them out from under a bed.

2. Zombie breaks down a door and smacks me in the face, promptly had to go replace pants.

3. Me and bro-op partner doing well. Out comes a zombie in riot gear, Broson gets eaten by a zombie, I'm left bleeding with 1 bullet, promptly eaten by Broson.

10/10 would get eaten by a zombified Broson again.

---
Extremely well done for a source engine game, needs some polish but its the first zombie game to fill the void left by BrainBread I've ever found. A bit buggy but worth it on sale for coop.

reviewText:
The price point is too high, but this game does a great job of recreating the tense, twitchy situations of Zombie Panic. The atmosphere and sound is good at setting the dark tone, and the combat takes a more realistic approach, requiring precise aim and manual reloading. Playing a survivor is fun: scavenging for weapons, barricading a house, avoiding the undead and taking a few of them out silently, then sneaking up on a fellow survivor and executing them for their sniper rifle and vantage point is satisfying. Playing as a zombie is frustrating, but it is about as good as it can be. Player zombies have slightly better manueverability and the ability control the horde.

There are three main modes: extraction, escape, and hunted. Hunted is the true gem. It is a PvP game mode where everyone starts off in a random spot with a few supplies, and the only rule is to be the last one left alive. I always try to forge an uneasy alliance with whoever is around me early on, each of us knowing that if things go our way then eventually one of us has to die. Large gunfights attract zombies, and any players who die become a fresh walker ready to head straight back for the camping point they just died at. It can get very tense, especially while hiding in a closet with a revolver pointed at the door while gunshots, broken windows and screams echo around you.

Extraction is a co-op mode has you going from house to house and searching for survivors, then fending off waves of zombies as you lead them to safety. It's fun and challenging because each person is limited in what they can carry and do. If a person is barricading they cannot shoot, and it is useless to have a sniper and shotgun at the same time. The AI survivors however, are useless and will die without protection, even with a gun. The maps also last way too long, and most people will not make it to the end.

Escape is an objective based co-op mode that isn't really all that enjoyable. As you work your way through various obstacles and puzzles, anyone who dies becomes a zombie. In the beginning it is too easy as there are only a few zombies to deal with. The difficulty either stays that way because everyone works together, or it falls apart because too many people die and overwhelm the survivors. The puzzles are okay but using a smart phone to check objectives and locations of keys isn't really that fun.

reviewText: This game is so fun its unreal, the game-modes are fun, kill other players or survive together to escape, this game has it, it is basically the sequel to Zombie panic source, and its better than it, while the game is still in early access and beta there are some glitches, the most annoying is zombies glitching through doors and walls, but its expected and will most likely be fixed, with regular updates this game is worth the money, even if you die its not one of those wait until  the remaining survivors find a safe room, or even wait until the next round situations, you die, you come back as a zombie and you can hunt down the remaining survivors, if you die a lot as a zombie you become a cockroach just to run around the map, reminds me of zombie survival on Gmod where you become a crow when your spectating, this is amazing to play with friends, get a party together, get voice chat going and have fun, its very fun going on the PvP game mode, if you die you hunt your friends as a zombie and laugh as they curse at you for infecting them. Worth the money, if you don't have enough then just wait for the sales, chances are it will be on offer

reviewText: For me this fills the gap in the Zombie survival horror genre very will indeed.  It is somewhere in between L4D and DayZ.  Escape is my favourite game mode at the moment. A good game and I look forward to seeing this title progress.

reviewText:
Contagion delivers a bit of a different and interesting exprience to the co-op zombie survival genre, it is fun and worth checking out for co-oping with friends or jumping on a server solo! thumbs up from me.

here is a rundown of the currently available game modes:

Deathmatch (The Hunt) - depending on which map you are playing the gameplay varies. its basically last one alive wins the round and the dead become zombie which speeds things up and makes it harder to survive. There are smaller more fast paced maps (the park map) or the suburb map which is much more suspenseful and involves a bit of hide and seek (you can board up a house and hide in the garage like a little girl). it never gets too boring cause you can always check your mobile phone which will tell you if people are around you and will give you audio clues about their location.

Escape - an objective based mode which takes place in a prison. the objectives are generated randomly and item placements change so in one play through you might be escaping from the garage and the other might get you up to the roof to a chopper. it is very suspensful and revolves around ammo conservation and team work. the diffculty level could be higher but maybe that's a setting I haven't found yet.

Extraction - revolves around helping NPCs escaping, haven't played it much so i can't really speak about it

If you like first person multiplayer games and enjoyed old school hl2/hl mods that experiment in gameplay this is for you.

reviewText:
Definately a great game!
GAMEPLAY:
If you love medium to slow phased zombie survival games, then this is your game. The mission and routes change on every new level, thus will force you to take new routes and look for hidden ammo. Ammo is rare and you have multiple weapons to look for. There are only a few maps and gamemodes. I personaly love the escape maps with friends and the PvP for online.
ZOMBIES:
Zombies are hard to kill. You can kill a zombie with one bullet in the head, or use 15 rounds on the body (at that may not even kill him!). Zombies are atracted to noise, so you can carefuly sneak by them and move on or perform a sneak kill. Zombies are all over the place, so if you have plenty of ammo and feel like a hero then use your rifles and pistols, that will attracks most of the zombies in the area. But if your team is hurt and are low on ammo, then you can sneak around them too.

reviewText:
An alright way to spend your time.  I don't know if it should really be worth $20, but it is a nice game.

Gameplay:  about like any other first-person-zombie-survival-shooter, so, check.
Graphics:  okay, check.
Sound: at times terrifying and at other times just down right annoying, check.

There are not may different game modes, but that's alright, things will always be changed up so you won't play a map the exact same way after just completing it.  I enjoyed the Co-op mode, but hated the PvP mode (only because I never got a chance, sniper from four or five buildings down the street or a player zombie just infected me while I was looking for some ammunition).

(In other words: I suck.)

It's an alright game, I enjoyed it.  I wouldn't say it's $20 alright, but if you could get it on sale, I would say go for it!

reviewText:
An alright way to spend your time.  I don't know if it should really be worth $20, but it is a nice game.

Gameplay:  about like any other first-person-zombie-survival-shooter, so, check.
Graphics:  okay, check.
Sound: at times terrifying and at other times just down right annoying, check.

There are not may different game modes, but that's alright, things will always be changed up so you won't play a map the exact same way after just completing it.  I enjoyed the Co-op mode, but hated the PvP mode (only because I never got a chance, sniper from four or five buildings down the street or a player zombie just infected me while I was looking for some ammunition).

(In other words: I suck.)

It's an alright game, I enjoyed it.  I wouldn't say it's $20 alright, but if you could get it on sale, I would say go for it!

reviewText:
So, Contagion.

I'm not a fan of twitch shooter's or zombie games, so when I recieved a copy of this game from one of my friends in an after christmas gift giving spree we all took part in... i was less than exicted.

While I am flat out terrible at the game, I will say that it is extremely enjoyable. The major reason? It perfectly captures the atmosphere of a Zombie Survival.

What I mean is, until you finally succumb to your wounds and the infection takes over, you will try your damndest to survive and help your other survivors, excepting the Hunt PvP game mode. When the infection takes over however, it becomes immensely satisfying to hunt down your friends and bury them beneath a horde of undead. The game really ramps up as soon as a survivor dies, as now one zombie that looks like any other, has human intelligence and wants everyone dead like them.

So yeah, I like it, and fans of Schadenfreude should too.
voteText: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
So me and my wife have put a little bit of time into this game.  At first I was pretty skeptical, considering I absolutely hated the Left 4 Dead series.  I'm just generally not a huge fan of the zombie genre (it's overdone imo).  But Contagion feels different.  You, as the player, are more involved.  We've really only played the Escape game mode, which for just the two of us is great.  And it seems a lot of the maps have randomly generated objectives when you play them.  Like some times a door may be blocked, but the next play through you can go through it and explore a different path to escape the map.  It makes replaying maps more enjoyable.

When you die, you become a zombie.  It'd say it's more fun on a public server with multiple players, but in a 2-player co-op setting, it's not that fun.  But I can see the effects it would have on a 6+ player server.

All in all, it's a pretty decent game.

reviewText:
3.5/5 game
I figured I would give this game a chance since it was up for free for the weekend. Now, I'm a big fan of killing zombies, I rarely get tired of putting a shot or a axe in the skull of a zombie. With this in mind, I like what Contagion is, but there are things about it I'm not too crazy about it. Before I go about posting what I think is great about the game, I will start with the things I'm not too crazy about.

1. Forgettable characters - Aside from picking the character you like, that is really about all there is to character selection. There just isn't anything that makes you remember the character beyond it's appearance.

2. Lack of a story - Now I know the game isn't a RPG or anything, but a little bit of story would be nice. Matter of fact it would be a nice way for the character's to be rememberable.

3. Flashlight needs work - Now the flashlight is very handy and by no means am I saying it's useless. However, why can the flashlight not light up rooms? It just seems to light up a small area and jeebus don't get too close to anything in particular with it. The light at the center can just about block out the view of items. You cannot even light up a room for a fellow survivor whose weapon doesn't allow a flashlight fitting.

4. Lack of Zombie variations - Aside from the standard Zombie, player Zombie, and Riot armored zombie. There really isn't anything else of danger around. A Zombie dog would have been a great addition to this game, or even enviromental hazards like falling buildings, out of control cars crashing, or something. A well organized team can easily put down a army of zombies, unless of course they're out of ammo.

5. Ammo hoarders - Don't get me wrong, when you need ammo badly, you need it badly. However, there are people that will pick up ammo for every gun BUT the gun they actually have. I cannot tell you how many times I've been down to one bullet and cannot even get a person to throw a magazine or ammo box my way.

6. Terrible Iron Sights - Now you don't need to serve a tour of duty in a war to tell some of these weapons have terrible iron sights. I've had times where I've woundered if it was easier to shoot from the hip or just aim down sights. Obviously it's better to aim down the sights, but some weapons just have such terrible iron sights it renders players ineffective at times. However, if you get use to the iron sights, you can easily work your way around their terrible design. Out of all the guns, your best bets are on the Pistols, the shotgun, and the hunting rifle. Pistols are semi-automatic, so you can control your rate of fire with them. Shotgun has bad iron sights, but it makes up for it with a wide shot spread so you just need to aim for the head. Heck you may even take down more than one zombie with a single shell. The Hunting rifle zooms in and it's the sniper rifle, so you don't have to deal with iron sights with it.

7. Getting stuck on stuff - This is more of a minor complaint, but there are times that it feels like I get stuck in doorways at times. It looks like I got enough room to enter, but some how I still get stuck.

Now for the things I like about the game.

1. The Enviroment - It actually feels like a proper zombie apocalypse. Nothing is clean, nothing is overly destroyed. Things feel just right.

2. Zombies are true to nature - Short of shooting them in the head, blowing them up with a grenade, or hitting them with a melee weapon. A zombie will keep coming after you. Thank you devs, these are true Zombies!

3. Sound effects  - The sound effects in this game are really good in my opinion. Since there is no real map to use, you can listen for the gun shots of your fellow survivors to actually tell you a general idea of what direction they're at. Or as a Zombie you can use it to find where your targets are at (short of using the vision sight for foot prints.) Overall everything sounds good in this game.

4. Limited resources - Nothing worse than playing a survival game and finding every little thing you need in the world in no time. Ammo, weapons, and medical kits are so hard to find. You actually have to concern yourself on how you approach the streets, corners, buildings, and rooms.

5. Infection - There is a chance when you get hit by a zombie that you actually get infected. If you're infected, there is a limit of time before you start to feel it and eventually turn against your fellow survivors. You won't know you're infected till it's too late. Some people may find this annoying, but I love it. Even if you die as a survivor, the game isn't over for you. Because now you can fight against them as a zombie and lead Hordes of zombies towards them. (Nice way of getting payback on those Ammo hoaders)

6. Board up and hold out - Now I know everyone likes base building, but honestly it get's old seeing player made sky forts or whatever. Contagion may not have base building, but boarding up windows is one of the most logical ways of keeping the zombies out. I just wish the boards didn't fall inbetween line of sights. If a Zombie gets close enough to try and break into the building, it's hard to get them off the window boards without shooting the defense itself.

7. Plenty of maps and game modes - The game isn't limited to just your typical Start at A and get to C by moving through B" (Though ti does have a escape mode which is fun still)
date: but you also have a PVP game mode where players start off killing each other
recommended: then holding out against zombie palyers in a game of Hide and seek. A objective based game where players locate survivors and take them to be extracted across zombie infested streets or neighborhoods. Also with players seemingly able to make their own playable maps

reviewText:
This game is awsome, No words just awsome one of the best games i ever played and i think that if you like the zombie games this games is probably recommended for you

Im going to leave some pros and cons that i think really shold be said-
Pros-
+Amazing Lighting Graphics
++Great Sound Physics
+Original Phone Gameplay
+/-If You Get Bitten You Can Turn Into A Zombie
+Awsome Workshop Support
+Maps Getting Added Every Month

Cons-
-Not Many Map
-Zombie AI Can Be Sometimes Buggy (And sometimes REALLY buggy)
--The Game Runs on non valve servers and hosting a server will almost always would requier you to Rent one if you want to play with friends on a Private Session
-Sometimes the hitbox of the zombies can be bugged so if you try to hit one it will not work
-Baracting Can Be Sometime Bugged

reviewText:
Okay, where do i begin?
This is an early access game.
That much is for sure but don't let that deceive you into thinking this game isn't good.
It has so much potential and with that in mind, play it without thinking of the other games that have come before it (Left 4 Dead 1-2, Killing Floor, etc.) so that you'll experience it as the devs intended. I like how they decided to make ammunition scarce, making the experience almost like real life. You are not likely to find a gun and a ton of ammo next to it behind a desk in real life. Well unless you're in a gun shop but i digress..
The stamina meter system forces players to pace themselves in order to survive as you would in a zombie apocalypse scenario.
Lastly, this game was meant to be played in Co-op. Playing it alone to practice is utterly boring, it would be better to play it with friends and gradually learn how to survive rather than do it on your own.

For an early access game it is really really good. I enjoyed playing, surviving, dying and shooting in the game and i'd play it again as soon as my friends are free to do so as well.

Solid 8/10 material. Would be 10/10 probably when the game is fully developed. I am excited to see what else they can put in the game.
voteText: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Admit it, thanks to DayZ, we are simply overflowed with zombie games.
Unfortunately most of them are monotone and feels like they're all the same.

Contagion is nothing like that. It's the good ol' Resident Evil in first person, created with the jolly good Source Engine.
The atmosphere gets tense slowly and the whole setting makes you feel that this growling you've just heard a minute ago somehow got louder, which means you're gonna cover your rear a lot.

There are many useful features like unloading weapons and taking mags from the same weapon types.
Although the game is still swimming in bugs and not that many maps, the potential gets bigger and bigger.

I want this game to become an Indie Game of 2014 year, do you understand, Mr. Monochrome LLC?

reviewText:
As of 3/10/2014, Contagion in Early Access.
Contagion is a wonderful concept. It's fun with friends, a blast really.
However, it can get dull as it does have a repetitive nature.
They did a hell of a job making areas really dark, keeping you on your toes.
Zombies can climb, crawl, jump.
If you become a zombie, you can pretty much hire nearby NPC zombies to follow you and make up your own horde to ambush the living. As the spiritual successor to Zombie Panic! Source, once again you can do some lunging and running.
As a human, you have stamina that does dwindle if you run around, but if you slow down you will quickly regain it.
They recently added a new map, but it is for the hunted gamemode. Pretty much that's a PVP free for all. On the plus side, if you become a zombie in this game, you don't have specials"

reviewText:
This game, is defiently the best co-op zombie game on the market right now (except L4D2 and Killing Floor) it is unique, bring many elements to the genre. From the gore system to different modes

I also like how the map changes everytime you start a new game, although those changes could be improved (as right now they only consist of blocked paths/doors)

One thing which I actually dont like is the weapon balacning. SMG's like the KJ9 somehow over powers the AR-15 despite the difference in caliber, maybe the defs could change it?

Another tip I'd like to see is, make the player rely on the healthpacks more? Maybe add bleed out effects once youre shot?

Other than that this is defiently worth 20$, great buy, endless fun and rage with friends.
8/10

reviewText:
**Playing Random Multiplayer Match**

Journal Entry 1

I've dropped into the street of an urban area, no idea where the hell I am or what im doing. Apparently im playing the role of a police officer who due to his talents and training has survived the undead takeover. I have a pistol and a flashlight and im feeling pretty good about how quiet these streets look. The houses are nice but show signs of being boarded up and busted in, whatever happened here... it happened fast!

Journal Entry 2

This is like an episode of Leave it to beaver... but there isn't any happy singing folks jumping around. I creep quietly along a white picket fence and take cover behind a white car. I can see someone up on the road walking really slowly.. Ok it looks like another player maybe? I turn off my light slowly creep up behind him, the closer I get the more odd the players behavior becomes. I get right up behind him and then he turns... well ... that's not a player at all, before me lies the bloodied face and nattering jaws of really nasty looking undead monster.

Journal Entry 3

I whip on my light and take a steady aim down the barrel.... The creature gives out a shriek and starts running at me, I take very careful calm aim and fire. A perfect headshot, I can see the exit wound clearly pop open from the back of his head like a straw going through the pre-cut slits in a slurpee lid. He instantly goes silent and falls to the ground with a thud, now I hear more noises and more shrieks from all around me. It appears we woke up the rest of his friends....

Journal Entry 4

The undead are now locked in on my position and waves of them from dirty back alleys and busted up backyard fences moan and scream as they come towards me. I begin picking off the closest targets that I can get, headshoting to the best of my ability. I kill probably a dozen but they keep coming, wave after wave. I'm running low on ammo now, I've only got 5 rounds left and there are about 10 zombies close enough to deserve the bullets. I've stupidly backed myself into a fenced yard with no escape route. The only way out is in the direction that the zombies are coming in... crap this is bad... well its been a good run... I take very careful aim and shoot the next 5 zombies with perfect headshots, behind them comes a hoard of about 7 more. I don't think I will be able to charge through them, I accept my defeat and wait for them to get me....

Journal Entry 5

All the sudden I hear gunfire... wtf.... I see flashlights bouncing off the cracks in the fence and footsteps running. I hear machine gun fire and pistols going off everywhere. A group of 3 other players rush in and save the day, a feeling of relief and awesomeness washes over me as they pick off the 7 zombies that were about to make dinner out of me. I join up with the group and follow them onward into the street.

Journal Entry 6

The hoards are getting worse and worse as we progress up the blocks of this pleasant valley neighborhood, Another player states that we need to go hold up somewhere until the waves calm down a bit. We find a reasonably well boarded up house and decide to take it over, we move in clearing room by room. I now have ammo again and am able to help out with the room clearing. Suddenly the waves of zombies decide to start charging the house, the doors are shut and the windows boarded.... it is here that we make our stand, we load up our guns and take our positions.... the screams of zombies makes it sound like thousands of them are outside... we begin to hear the doors getting kicked and smashed.... they are coming through... lets do this!

9/10

reviewText:
The very popular sequel to Infection, Infection 2: Disease, Infection 3: Spreading Viruses, Infection 4: Transmition Proliferation Dissemination Simulator 2012.

The main story revolves around the Contaigions that were caused by infectious agents such as viruses, viroids, and prions, microorganisms such as bacteria, nematodes such as roundworms and pinworms, arthropods such as ticks, mites, fleas, and lice, fungi such as ringworm, and other macroparasites such as tapeworms. You personally are responsible to attempt to counter the current contaigion in the areas by all of the equipment that you have.

There's also a minor sub plot involving zombies, who are fictional undead creatures regularly encountered in horror and fantasy themed works. They are typically depicted as mindless, reanimated corpses with a hunger for human flesh, and particularly for human brains in some depictions. Although they share their name and some superficial similarities with the zombie from Haitian Vodun, their links to such folklore are unclear.

reviewText:
This game has many rough edges (which is to expect, being an alpha). Hitbox issues, the inventory is horrible, animation quirks, bugs, and a lot of small, but visible problems.

That being said, it's a surprisingly nice game, and I am getting more enjoyment out of that I thought I would.

It runs the risk of being TOO punishing on its players, though. I would love to have the ability to customize my game further, adding things like the ability to ressurect dead players. It really sucks when you want to just play a co-op session with your friends and one of them dies in the beginning and cannot play with the rest of the game.

There isn't a lot of content yet, but it's a very promising game that if you don't get now, you should definetly get upon release.

reviewText:
Well i have put in 4 hours into Contagion so far and mostly played Hunter mode. So far im loving this game! definitly worth the 10 bucks i spent.
A lot of reviews seem to say bad visuals, bad maps, no point to it... i highly disagree.
For a short summary, Hunter Mode is so much fun. its a couple humans scrounging for weapons and ammo, while having the ability to barricade windows and doors a bit from zombies. Its PvP during the hunt for ammo and guns and also to avoid the odd zombie or horde of zombies that come your way if you stay still. You can only kill a zombie with a headshot or a melee weapon to the head and shooting will also give away your position, as does your flashlight! Oh and you carry around an Android Smartphone and you need to pop it up often to see when enimies are nearby (also vibrates when close) and what your objectives are.

I have seen one glitch so far in Extraction mode where the AI human got glitched in a bush and we couldnt complete the match.

But overall from 4 hours of continual play, i highly enjoy this game and its a blast if you have a couple of buddies or not to play with!

8/10

Pros:
Good Visuals (id compare to L4D2 for visuals)
teamwork
exploration
intense

Cons:
The odd glitch.
not a lot of maps (enough to be satisfied with)
some servers are laggy (as are all games)

reviewText: Contagion is a fun interesting twist on the zombie survival horror genre. It has multiple modes to play which include Escape, Extraction, Panic, Hunted, etc. In each mode you generally start off as a survivor, though sometimes you do start as a zombie. Your mission: to survive as long as possible. Once you die you get to control a zombie and attack the other survivors. It can be a really fun experience, though at times it can be somewhat boring due in large part to how big the maps are. After playing all the modes I think I like Extraction the best since it has alot of AI zombies along with the player controlled ones. That and the survivors have to hold out at certain locations which makes finding them easy. Oh yeah, and zombies have special abilities unique to them. For $4.99(as of 9/1/14) it's definitely worth it! The developer has already said that ALL future DLC will be free of charge. That's a pretty good deal!

reviewText: This is a surprisingly great game.  It plays well and feels very realistic. reviewText:
Contagion is a zombie survival game with a number of game mode focused on online play. In the game you can either play as a zombie or as a person when playing pvp which is fun to play both sides. As the person you can do your basic FPS mechanics and as a zombie you are the normal zombie exept you have a small speed boost and you can call a horde to your side from any zombies near to you. Theres also an extraction game mode where you have to try to save civilians without letting anyone die. There are more game modes to suchas one that can act like a story guiding you through a map. I personally found myself playing a pvp all alone just for the fun of blasting zombies away without worry of someone else trying to kill me.
When it comes to inventory, you have 4 weapon slots and you can carry so much ammo it's not a worry, but that leads me into the next thing, getting ammo and supplies.
You start off every match witha random melee wapon and a pistol of some sort. From there, you must scavenge. You must break into peoples houses, movie theaters, malls, really anywhere and search high and low for things (don't worry about how the locals feel about this, they've already been infected). You can find anything from med kits to nail guns to wooden planks to assault rifles to varrying types of ammo to an occasional greanade (just try not to blow yourself up). This is a game where your shots count though and you shouldn't fire until you know it's going to be a head shot. A zombie can take a very large sum of bullets to the body or a single shot to the head.
Contagion did do a nive job with the models and what they look like when they take damage for the bodies. When you put a round in an undead's head, you can see a large exit would on the other side. If you blast their leg with a shot gun, it may come right off. If you hammer away at their chest, you may leave a nice cavity there. The point is, you can blast an enemy to smitherines and you'll be able to tell.
In the game you can also make a 'home base' type area such as when you're in the suburban map. The game provides nail guns and planks of wood if you look around to help secure an area. You can make this place a stock pile, a temporary place to just sit for a minute, or simply slow the zombies down for a few seconds while you run for your life out the back door.
Contagion also has large maps, especially the city one which I think is something like 9 full sized blocks (also if you look enough, this is the one game to put a gun store in it if you need a couple extra rounds. *wink wink, nudge nudge*) This is great when needing to run from another player or when you just feel like exploring.
The graphics in the game are good... but only at night. I've noticed that durring the daytime nothing looks as good as it could be, and though that may just be a time/budget thing to make it look good, just try not to look too closely at textures in the sunlight. When it comes to night time it does look very pleasing to the eye with their lighting engine and the reflections in everything. You can see this which helps to show off what it can do and with the lack of sunlight makes it so you don't focus on any below-par textures.
Lastly for what I have to say about the looks of the enviroment is rain. Just rain. It looks very nice compared to many other games I have played especially with the lighting engine to help show it off. You can see small ripples if you look close enough to where a rain drop has landed and little things like that.
Finally, I would just like to point out the sound. They did a great job with the sound like when you step on a piece of fallen fence you can hear it shake, of when you step on broken glass and hear it crack. My point is, it sounds nice.

The good-
-Great lighting engine (if anything it's a tad too bright with the flashlight, but that's fairly small depending on where you are
-Zombies look great when heavily damaged
-Nice sound
-big maps
-good, serious atmosphere
-if you look close enough, most of the little extra stuff like books do actually have titles and such.

The bad-
-player zombies feel a bit underpowered (but thats probably to help balence)
-map size can make multiplayer difficult
-revolves anound the same mechanics most of the time, it's more just who you're shooting at.

The ugly-
-It may just be me but I've noticed a case of fuzzy screen" when playing this that usually doesn't happen with other games
-don't look at textures to close in the day time

Rating: 7.5-8/10
If you catch it for under $5 on a steam sale I definatelty reccomend
date: it's a fun game but some will like it more than others."

reviewText:
So, Contagion.

I'm not a fan of twitch shooter's or zombie games, so when I recieved a copy of this game from one of my friends in an after christmas gift giving spree we all took part in... i was less than exicted.

While I am flat out terrible at the game, I will say that it is extremely enjoyable. The major reason? It perfectly captures the atmosphere of a Zombie Survival.

What I mean is, until you finally succumb to your wounds and the infection takes over, you will try your damndest to survive and help your other survivors, excepting the Hunt PvP game mode. When the infection takes over however, it becomes immensely satisfying to hunt down your friends and bury them beneath a horde of undead. The game really ramps up as soon as a survivor dies, as now one zombie that looks like any other, has human intelligence and wants everyone dead like them.

So yeah, I like it, and fans of Schadenfreude should too.
voteText: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
So me and my wife have put a little bit of time into this game.  At first I was pretty skeptical, considering I absolutely hated the Left 4 Dead series.  I'm just generally not a huge fan of the zombie genre (it's overdone imo).  But Contagion feels different.  You, as the player, are more involved.  We've really only played the Escape game mode, which for just the two of us is great.  And it seems a lot of the maps have randomly generated objectives when you play them.  Like some times a door may be blocked, but the next play through you can go through it and explore a different path to escape the map.  It makes replaying maps more enjoyable.

When you die, you become a zombie.  It'd say it's more fun on a public server with multiple players, but in a 2-player co-op setting, it's not that fun.  But I can see the effects it would have on a 6+ player server.

All in all, it's a pretty decent game.

reviewText:
Terrible game.  I read one of the positive reviews and wonder what game they played.  This game is confusing and glitchy.  The cell phone, which gives you your missions, had text that was too large for its screen, so I ended up with only a quarter or less of the goal description, which was useless.

I spawned (twice) in a building that had no way out.  I gave it the benefit of the doubt and searched for a key or something to open the outside doors, and after about an hour of searching, gave up and disconnected.  It wasn't even that big a building.  Even if there WAS a way out, a good game doesn't have you sitting around with nothing to do for an hour.

Buttons would sometimes not do what they were supposed to.  Once I ran out of ammo, and it wouldn't let me melee.  What is worse, when you do melee, it feels like your just slapping the zombie.  If I was gonna hit a zombie, I'd hit the zombie hard enough to knock it over or break something.  In the game, I hit a zombie over and over and over, and it never got knocked back, and it never died.  Finally a teammate found me and shot it.

Someone mentioned how much fun it was to not have much ammo.  Well, I got stuck without ammo on a ladder with zombies at the top, and I couldn't get them out of the way.  These zombies finally discovered the perfect strategy.  Just swallow the ammo and stand on the ladders, and there's no way they'll ever escape.

If this game has any hope of being a fun experience, they've got a lot of work to do.  It isn't exciting.  It isn't scary.  It isn't fun.  What were they hoping the game would be?  And why have a free weekend when the game is in such a terrible state?

I'll follow this up by saying that the game may have some redeeming qualities that I didn't see.  I didn't play much, and won't be coming back, so I may have missed the best it has to offer.  But with so many excellent games out there... I don't see how they can balance out the hours of unexplained, empty, lonely exploration that concluded in exiting to desktop.

reviewText:
As a huge fan of Zombie Panic source I was without a doubt looking forward to this game. Sadly the hype was for naught as it did not live up to my expectations at all.

The game as a whole simply doesn't seem to be finished, it's buggy, doesn't play well and is visually unpleasant. In my opinion it could have been something worth while if the developers had put some more time into it, polished it up and ironed out any and all buggs that the game is currently riddled with.

Buy it on a 80% or more sale if you're a fan of ZPS otherwise, just let this one slide.
