reviewText: If the idea of another Zombie title wasn't enough to turn you away, surely being 1 hit killed by a ninja zombie and losing 25 minutes of map progress will break your will. Contagion is a good example of why realism in fantasy setting gaming is not necessary. I tried to find something new offered by this title, but the truth is the idea was played out 2 years ago. While there are several game modes that differ from static zombie survival, I feel like they are held back by the element of realism" this game tries to portray.\n\nModes like Panic just left me feeling frustrated
date: Survival mode is fancy wording for "camping"
recommended: Extraction just spawns dozens of zombies on top of your group
hoursPlayed: and Escape pits downed teammates against you. Often spawning them relatively close to try and troll your 25 minutes of map progress. I suspect the game was built with "Escape" mode in mind

votesFunny: the developers DID put time into the title. Maps are dynamic

reviewText:
Contagion is exactly like what imagine where the left for dead series would go, if the next iteration had an extra chromosome.  or perhaps the designers for left for dead or other good games had created a list of all the good things and a list of bad things to put into a survival horror game, and Contagion is what happens when someone uses the wrong list as their design base?

its the last cohesive gameplay experience i think i have ever had. lets design a team survival game, with no functional map, or hud display of any kind to indicate where your team is, how ways in which you can work together, then lets make it super dark so you knee jerk shoot your team when they come within a 100 yards of you and startle you a bit

then lets maybe think of ways we can design maps so that are so homiginized that navigating them is a joke because every area looks just like every other area, and since you dont have a map of any kind all you get to do is walk around in the dark until your team mates  shoot you for ...walking around looking for your team mates..... good times to be had by all

reviewText: I played Contagion during the time it was free so my time was short. The concepts in the game were a lot of fun. Working together, hunting, being hunted, extractions etc. As small of a thing as it was, I thought the cellphone idea was cool. Overall, I would not pay anything for this game if it receives no major updates.\n\nThe controls are very clunky. Granted, this is partially due to my machine, but I found the gameplay very rough when the action was on. Graphics-wise, I was not super disappointed (because I paid nothing) but given what is out there I would expect more. Gameplay was only fun because I played with others. Oddly enough, I agreed with another player who said the running around searching for a way out and looking for ammo/tools was probably more like a 'real' zombie apocalypse than running and gunning everywhere. Playing as a zombie was basically like Left 4 Dead but worse. I would have preferred dying and waiting for my teammates to die or win instead of playing as a zombie OP. Potential is there but not fulfilled.

reviewText:
Ok so this is going to be a very long review.

Let me start with the positive points:

-great gameplay
-great concepts
-awesome graphics
- innovative mechanisms ( phone , boltcutters etc)

This game has a very high potential to become one of the best zombie games out there, but as I said it : POTENTIAL.
For the moment being, this game has a nice surface but a ♥♥♥♥♥♥ core.
Contagion looks fantastic but the lacking features which are a must have for such a COOP heavy game are pretty scare in my opinion.
Here are the negative points to explain my view:

- questionable hit boxes ( often times shooting with a gun to the direct head of a zombie is sometimes more random than skill)
- not enough ammo
- no tutorial" or easy level to get  new people started
- randomized maps
- not many maps ( it's normal for a beta I guess)
- no "through the wall" zombie vision

Alright
date: let's start with the ammo problem and combine it with the randomized maps.\nThe ammo on the maps is WAY too little for the amount of players.\nSince this game is in a beta stage and a lot of new people are currently joining in
recommended: it's very very hard to coordinate around the maps
hoursPlayed: even harder to search ammo while watching ones ♥♥♥ not to be bitten from behind.\nThe randomized map constructions are a nice thing
voteText: no doubt
helpfulPercent: but applying that one a map so little and complicated to manoveur like the one with the jail is a shot in ones own foot.\nIt makes the map impossible to get around with and the lack of ammo makes players explore the map even more
votesHelpful: which often leads to people splitting completly up and everyone being alone
votesTotal: thus ending up eaten in 3 mins without even getting to first objectives.\nThe maps which exist are for most part easy on the surface
votesFunny: such as the neighbourhood one
commentsCount: but on the other hand a labirinth ( the jail). It would have been nice to develop a basic survival or objective map which is easy to find the objectives with and not too hard to navigate without a map and decent common sense. ( the umbrella map from ZPS for example)\n\nAs for the hitboxes
column16: it may be only me
column17: but considering I have a pretty decent ping and FPS
column18: I don't think I can blame my aim for not hitting the heads since I am a long yeared FPS - Gamer.\n\nThe zombies not having a "through the wall" vision like in L4D is not something neccessary
column19:
but it would help zombies find the survivors easier since zombies don't have it any easier to navigate the maps than the survivors.
The shooting sounds of the guns are unreliable to the distance and location and thus don't really help THAT much.
It would be nice to let the zombies have a 5 meter range through the wall vision or something similar.

Alright
column20: this is my review so far.\nI am ready to accept change and fixes

reviewText:
Contagion is a zombie survival game with a number of game mode focused on online play. In the game you can either play as a zombie or as a person when playing pvp which is fun to play both sides. As the person you can do your basic FPS mechanics and as a zombie you are the normal zombie exept you have a small speed boost and you can call a horde to your side from any zombies near to you. Theres also an extraction game mode where you have to try to save civilians without letting anyone die. There are more game modes to suchas one that can act like a story guiding you through a map. I personally found myself playing a pvp all alone just for the fun of blasting zombies away without worry of someone else trying to kill me.
When it comes to inventory, you have 4 weapon slots and you can carry so much ammo it's not a worry, but that leads me into the next thing, getting ammo and supplies.
You start off every match witha random melee wapon and a pistol of some sort. From there, you must scavenge. You must break into peoples houses, movie theaters, malls, really anywhere and search high and low for things (don't worry about how the locals feel about this, they've already been infected). You can find anything from med kits to nail guns to wooden planks to assault rifles to varrying types of ammo to an occasional greanade (just try not to blow yourself up). This is a game where your shots count though and you shouldn't fire until you know it's going to be a head shot. A zombie can take a very large sum of bullets to the body or a single shot to the head.
Contagion did do a nive job with the models and what they look like when they take damage for the bodies. When you put a round in an undead's head, you can see a large exit would on the other side. If you blast their leg with a shot gun, it may come right off. If you hammer away at their chest, you may leave a nice cavity there. The point is, you can blast an enemy to smitherines and you'll be able to tell.
In the game you can also make a 'home base' type area such as when you're in the suburban map. The game provides nail guns and planks of wood if you look around to help secure an area. You can make this place a stock pile, a temporary place to just sit for a minute, or simply slow the zombies down for a few seconds while you run for your life out the back door.
Contagion also has large maps, especially the city one which I think is something like 9 full sized blocks (also if you look enough, this is the one game to put a gun store in it if you need a couple extra rounds. *wink wink, nudge nudge*) This is great when needing to run from another player or when you just feel like exploring.
The graphics in the game are good... but only at night. I've noticed that durring the daytime nothing looks as good as it could be, and though that may just be a time/budget thing to make it look good, just try not to look too closely at textures in the sunlight. When it comes to night time it does look very pleasing to the eye with their lighting engine and the reflections in everything. You can see this which helps to show off what it can do and with the lack of sunlight makes it so you don't focus on any below-par textures.
Lastly for what I have to say about the looks of the enviroment is rain. Just rain. It looks very nice compared to many other games I have played especially with the lighting engine to help show it off. You can see small ripples if you look close enough to where a rain drop has landed and little things like that.
Finally, I would just like to point out the sound. They did a great job with the sound like when you step on a piece of fallen fence you can hear it shake, of when you step on broken glass and hear it crack. My point is, it sounds nice.

The good-
-Great lighting engine (if anything it's a tad too bright with the flashlight, but that's fairly small depending on where you are
-Zombies look great when heavily damaged
-Nice sound
-big maps
-good, serious atmosphere
-if you look close enough, most of the little extra stuff like books do actually have titles and such.

The bad-
-player zombies feel a bit underpowered (but thats probably to help balence)
-map size can make multiplayer difficult
-revolves anound the same mechanics most of the time, it's more just who you're shooting at.

The ugly-
-It may just be me but I've noticed a case of fuzzy screen" when playing this that usually doesn't happen with other games
-don't look at textures to close in the day time

Rating: 7.5-8/10
If you catch it for under $5 on a steam sale I definatelty reccomend
date: it's a fun game but some will like it more than others."

reviewText:
A great experience and very fun. I have a rather poor computer but it ran pretty well after some work. However, early beta is 100% correct. Very fun with friends, actually with friends is recommended. Sadly, I have a VERY hard time by myself. A shame, seeing how easy it was to play singleplayer. While playing, things would not spawn, mainly the keys in the beginning of the Escape level. I would be running between the two security rooms for almost an hour not finding any keys. Seeing how everything is in different places with every game, it felt like the spawns went a little crazy, felt like the whole mission was broken. With Extraction, the game is rather impossible to complete. (for a new player to the game like me) This game seemed like I HAD to play with other people in order for the game to WORK.

That being said, the graphics are very impressive and the zombie hit boxes are surprisenly well done. The random spawns are always fun  when first playing, but again, they need to WORK so people may proceed with the mission.  Instead of randomly generating EVERYTHING, maybe keep key items in the same room but in a different area. Seriously, I have to restart an escape mission 3 different times just so I could find the damn KEYS! I'm sure I am just not searching hard enough but I think looking for about an hour enough to say that the items are a little broken when being placed.

Very good game, fustratingly hard, broken feel, but stil worth it. Hope you guys fix the bugs for singleplayer so people who like playing alone be able to play instead of punishing them by making them play with others. But again, in Beta so I am hoping they can fix the mistakes and I really like the game.

reviewText:
From the time i have played this game, i had found it quite enjoyable for its gamemodes and realistic sense. The maps seem reasonable and interesting, each one actually seems different from the others for sure, whether it be mission wise or landscaping. Weapons also seem just right for about everything when it comes to how its useful and the damage it gives off.

However, while playing this i have noticed, and yes you may quote me on this, it seems to be partially infested with players having huge ego. By this, i mean that when i enter a server, reguardless of game mode, some people tend to team kill or purposely find a way to get another person killed just to ruin progress. This is my only issue it seems, besides the first escape mission, where the mission progression seems to take forever at times just to get to the next task.

With this all being said, its a good game. Great even, if you can get passed the idiots looking for attention. My suggestion is to play this game with no friendly fire, and/or player zombies. (Player zombies do get quite out of hand at times i must add.)

reviewText: Save your money - seriously, this feels like a mod for a non-fun C-titled game. We played 4 player co-op and some online with others...the only fun" I had was
date: after dying...trying to hunt down my team mates and kill them as a zombie. Outside of that...I was falling asleep. Mindless shooting that isn't even fun. It's just simply NOT FUN...AT ALL...and I am usually extremely forgiving if I feel the developer is genuinely trying to create a fun project for others to enjoy. Didn't get that from this title. It feels like a bunch of teenagers in high school threw this together on their weekends during a busy school year...not that that is a bad thing...but in this case it is. There is nothing about this title that would even cause me to want to give it a second look. Thankfully
recommended: my son is the one who blew his money on this title...he has learned his lesson now in checking out several player reviews and weighing the "pros" and "cons" of what people are either complaining about or giving credit for.\n\ntl;dr   GET SOMETHING ELSE"

reviewText: Great game that expands upon the legacy of Zombie Panic and takes it to another level. Combine that with genuinely approachable developers who are in touch with the community that play their game, lifelong free DLC, a great community of players and you have a recipe for good times. Of course it won't be as big as ZPS but that's the best zombie multiplayer game of all time, nothing can touch it.\n\nContagion - 8.5/10. Excellent. Buy it and never look back! (except to ZPS)

reviewText: I do not recomend this game, the graphics suck, the engine is buggy and it is horibly unbalanced. If you are looking for a good co op zombie survival game with a good engine, good graphics and an intresting variety of maps i would recomend No More Room in Hell". This game is an obvious rip off that charges 20 $ for an expirance you can get else where for free."

reviewText:
I was playing this on free weekend and gave it a try. There are many flaws and features on it. For example there should be a voting system. IMO some of the players are tired of playing dozens of rounds for it to change the map or gamemode.
It also gets very repitive after a while, (In my opinion). I found it fun but it really isn't worth the money, i keep playing because its fun to do co op etc. On the other hand the game could of offered more but it didn't.


4/10 - Gets boring and repitive but really stresses teamwork on most maps.

reviewText: If this was a HL2 mod I'd be pretty happy and ignore the terrible old graphics, clipping and random flying zombies. But its not.\n\nI have to say though bizzarely I have been drawn back into this game. With a few people on mics escape maps are quite fun. Hunter maps are dull DM style nonsense and I'd rather play a real DM game. For the price of a pint its ok to waste a few hours, for 20 quid you have to be joking.
